Reviews.Title: Not bad for the price
Reviews.Author: Angie
Reviews.Content: I previously bought an LG 42LD550, used it for a few months and was quite happy with its quality, but the 42" screen size was a little too small for my living room, so I decided to get a bigger TV instead. The LD550 has better features than the LK520 -- its internet application was one thing that attracted me, but it requires an adapter which doesn't come with the TV, so I never got to test it. I guess I don't need this feature anyway,  so I returned it and bought the 47" LK520, at the same price --- it was on sale on Amazon for about 7 hundred.The shipping:This model came out in March 2011, and I placed the order in April. I guess because it is relatively new, so I had to wait 4-6 weeks for the product to be shipped.So after waiting patiently for over one month, my TV finally came. I was expecting the guys from the shipping company to open the box and let me check the TV, just like what they did when I bought the other LG model. I was surprised when they told me they couldn't open the box, and that I should open it on my own, and keep the box for a year in case I need to return it. This sounds a little weird, but I signed the delivery sheet anyway.The assembling:It only took a few minutes to assemble this TV. My brother and I laid the panel on my sofa bed with the screen facing down, and secured the base/stand with a few screws. It looks like the stand was made of some cheap plastic. I hope it's more sturdy than it looks.The look:This TV has a simple, sophisticate design. I like the matt screen and the glossy black frame. There's a small blue light on the lower right corner when the TV is on. Althought the remote control is easy to use, the design looks boring and cheap, some buttons/features seem like a duplicate to me. But I guess it's not a big deal, as long as it works.Sound quality:There are several sound modes you can choose from. It was set to "standard" by default, and the volume was low,  but it was much better once I switched it to "music" or "cimema". I also turned on the "surround sound" feature. Over all I am happy with the sound quality.Picture quality:I've had this TV for about two weeks now, at first I was impressed with the picture quality -- it's crisp and clear, and the color looks very nice, just like the LD550 model. I set the picture mode to "Cinema" --the "standard" mode is a bit too bright for my sensitive eyes. Of course you can create and save your own picture mode by adjusting the brightness, color, and contrast, etc.  But one day I noticed the brightness on the TV screen changed suddenly --- it went darker,  then after a while it went bright again (looks similar to when there are rolling clouds in the sky on a sunny day).  I didn't turn on the "inteligent sensor" and I think the lighting in my room didn't change. I did not have this problem with the LD550 model. I am not sure if I got a defective item or what.  Right now I give this TV a 4 star, and hoping there's an easy fix for the brightness problem. I'll test it for a few more days and decide whether I should call LG, or return it....*** UPDATE: I found out the reason that my TV would suddenly go darker is because I had the "Engergy Saver" on (it was set to "Auto"). So whenever the sensor in the TV detects a change of lighting in the room, it'll adjust the screen brightness automatically. Sometimes the screen goes so dark I can hardly see. I am not sure how much energy it can save by doing this, but I find it annoying to me, so I turned the feature off, and the problem solved! I am glad I don't have to return this TV. I am happy with my purchase so far.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: rkay48
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for only a few days, but it appears to be exactly what I wanted.  The LK520 LG model is very similar to the earlier model LD520 (highly rated), except that the dynamic contrast is apparently a bit better for the LK520(150K to 1 vs 100K), but I suspect that may not be that significant.INPUT-OUTPUTIt has sufficient inputs (HDMI, component, etc), and outputs, although I still wish these new HDTVs had a regular stereo output (ie., 2 RF outputs) so I could use them with my old amplifier. The LK520 only has 1 optical digital audio output.  However, the sound from the LK520 speakers is surprisingly robust, although most will probably want more to complete the home theater experience.  The LK520 also has a USB port, but I have not used this yet. The specs say you can connect your external USB devices for JPEG photos or MP3 files. (Note, this model does NOT have any internet connection capabilities--however you could hook this up to a BluRay DVD player that has this capability, if you want it).I hooked up my cable box via an HDMI cord, and the LK520 provides a clear HD picture and does well with regular SD channels also.  I hooked up the TV with component inputs from my oldish DVD player, and it looked very good.  (Some day I will get a BluRay, so I can see more pores, I guess, on close ups...).FEATURESThe LK520 has 120 Hz, so if you watch a lot of sports, this might be important (I don't).  So maybe the 60 Hz LG LK450 might be OK for you, and save you 60-80$. However, note that the LK520 has a slightly higher dynamic contrast compared to the 60 Hz 42 inch LG LK450 (150K vs 100K).The weight is only about 35 lbs, so it is relatively easy (if a bit awkward) to carry around. Also, the screen does not seem to have any serious reflection problems in stronger lighting situations.The TV picture can be adjusted to your preferences, but I found the default settings good enough for me.  It is Energy Star rated, which is good, but I found the "intelligent sensor" adjustments a bit too dark for me.  However, you can adjust this as your wish.SUMMARY:  I don't think you can go wrong with this excellent LG HDTV. I would rate it at 4.5 stars. Some minor limitations on audio output and the somewhat high price that I paid at a big box store (BB) made me give it a 4 instead of 5.I may update this if I find any problems later....

Reviews.Title: PERFECT!!
Reviews.Author: KJcool
Reviews.Content: skip intro and specs because you guys can find those anywhere onlinei read through all the reviews before i bought this TV and it helped a lot. Hopefully this would help as well.Some features are tested and here is the quick review:-120HZ TruMotion works perfectly, way better than 60HZ and other 120HZ TVs, PS3 (black-ops and Top Spin 4) and 3 1080P videos (scene,sports and concert) tested.2.4ms response time makes everything so smooth.-REALLY Stunning picture, color depth-good, brightness-good, high contrast 150,000:1 (12 HD pictures tested, each of them was at least 15 MB)-SOUND quality is better than i thought. Couldnt be happier so far. Would recommend this product for friends. Will update if any problems pop upthis is my first product review..Thanks for reading.

Reviews.Title: Great buy!!!
Reviews.Author: Andre Antonio
Reviews.Content: I'm not the review type and I don't have much time, so here goes my short review:This is an awesome TV and I spent MUCH time researching and comparing TV's in stores.I wanted a SAMSUNG as research showed them to be (arguably) the best brand.Every SAMSUNG looked better in the stores I went to, in most price ranges. The exception were some of the PANASONIC plasmas, but they were out of my budget anyway.My budget was about $600-$800 and I decided on LCD over Plasma. Didn't consider LED for it's higher price range.I wanted it to be 120hz and have the best possible picture quality.I was set to get the Samsung LN46C630, then this LG grabbed my attention. Bear in mind I was limiting myself to the lower end models that don't have all the extra features I would not care to have.LUCKLY, one fo the stores I went to have these 2 TV's side-by-side!And it was a VERY close call, sometime I found the LG to have better picture, sometimes the SAMSUNG. I was impressed that LG as a brand would stand up to Samsung.Please do understand comparing in stores is a great way to do this, but not completely reliable as TV's would have different calibration settings (or lack of) and generally they have a store-demo mode which makes the picture look bright and stuff to draw attention to itself.Then I found a smoking deal on the LG, which made it very easy to decide.I could have gone either way and been happy.

Reviews.Title: Don't believe the reviews.
Reviews.Author: Wolfmanatee
Reviews.Content: The average review on Amazon for this TV model (LK520) is in the upper 4 star range...  and that is absolutely insane. I'd like to provide a different perspective.PICTUREThe screens suffer from the dirty screen effect where white backgrounds show visible gradients that are not part of the intended visual experience but rather a side effect of a cheap panel. Unsuitable for gaming, especially on XBOX. There is a significant amount of motion blurring in fast-paced games like BLACK OPS and DEUS EX whenever the field of view is shifted (impossible to read text on walls when turning your character, for example). PS3 games ran better, but the motion blur was still present regardless of setting combinations for the TV's display configurations. Static, unmoving images during movies look great--but when the characters start moving, or especially when the camera pans, you will notice quite a bit of judder and blur even with the anti-judder and anti-blur settings cranked all the way up to 10.AUDIOAbout what you'd expect for a budget-priced LCD TV. In other words, inferior to most built-in speakers in CRT/Tube TVs. CINEMA mode significantly increased the quality of the sound, however, making it so-so in quality.OTHERPlease note that the TV's stand is absolutely terrible. The TV is anything but stable, and I can't recommend this TV to anyone if you don't plan on mounting it on a wall as the stand wobbles quite a bit (see youtube videos for demonstrations). The menu/interface for the TV was actually very well done--I hope that whatever TV I end up with permanently handles the features and settings so fluidly.NOTESWith LCD TVs, you always get what you pay for. The BRAVIA line, for example, is vastly superior--I set this LG model up next to my brother's Bravia and the difference in image quality was staggering (which makes sense, considering that model runs for about 200-300 more than this LG model). Gaming especially was worlds apart. Additionally, these models are subject to the panel lottery--where you will get one of three LCD panels of varying quality. In other words, you may just end up with a version of this model that's comparatively inferior to other LK520s.MY EXPERIENCEUPS broke the first TV, but Amazon's customer service was excellent--they had a second TV on my doorstep two days later. I recently returned the second one after extensive tuning/testing/comparisons with other TVs and Amazon did a great job with paying for shipping back out to them. Amazon gets five stars, UPS gets one star, this TV gets three stars.I can't recommend this TV. Listen--even in its price range, this LCD is about average. If you don't really care about movie quality and you just want a big-ish TV that you can watch standard cable TV on, go for it. But for anyone who plays games, cares about image/picture quality on DVDs/Blu-Rays, you will want to jump up a price range or two.

Reviews.Title: Entering the 21st century - finally
Reviews.Author: Cassandra.
Reviews.Content: This LG 42LK520 is replacing my well-loved Toshiba CRT tv (which, to my dismay, refused to age or give any sign it was ready to quit and justify my purchase), so I can't claim great sophistication when it comes to comparing modern, flat-panel TVs.Having said that, I couldn't be happier with this LG. The image is crisp and true. The color saturation on the default setting is perhaps a touch brighter than life - which I'm sure can be manipulated easily, but I rather like seeing the world with bright green grass and impossibly blue sky, so I haven't bothered. The trumotion works well and so far I have seen no after-image or blur. The sound quality is good, but not great, but it matters little to me as I run it through my fairly old home theatre system which makes the whole experience  quite wonderful. I even like the subtle light that glows on the lower right corner and turns from red to blue when you turn the tv on - totally unrelated to the tv's performance, but it's just cool and makes the tv look expensive.  I am enjoying this TV tremendously, and sometimes will turn it on just to look at how nice the picture is.For about $650 with free shipping, how could I not be happy? Shipping was impressively quick. Set up was relatively easy, though the installation manual is so simple as to be relatively useless. Incidentally, if you're hooking it up to your satellite receiver, you have to press "input" on your remote and then select "HDMI" - the instruction manual doesn't tell you this.None of the minor weaknesses (like the sound - which isn't bad, it just didn't blow me away) are signficant enough to drop it out of five-star range.  At this price point this TV provides incredible value. I really could not be happier with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: What a Deal!
Reviews.Author: Jeremy
Reviews.Content: While I didn't get this TV at Amazon, I still got it for about the same price (give or take a hundred bucks).I was looking for a new TV watching experience, coming from an old Sony Trinitron 34" CRT, I was very excited about going to a 55" LCD.  I spent a good amount of time looking online for the best bargain and probably set my expectations quite high.  I decided to go with a brand that I've always known and trusted.  LG did not let me down.The giant viewing area of the screen provides a beautiful, sharp picture.  I notice no lag or ghosting at all watching through Verizon FIOS, a standard DVD player, or an XBox 360.  I've yet to hook a blu-ray player up, but completely look forward to doing so.  The sound quality is outstanding, I typically leave it at about 20% of it's max, and it's plenty loud enough to hear across the room.  Even cranked up, there's no hum or static from the speakers and the sound quality is good.As for features, I decided on price over some of the cooler potential features.  This TV is NOT 3D compatible.  It doesn't have Netflix or any of that.  Keeping that stuff off, however, keeps the price very reasonable.  In addition, the USB port accepts a USB device and seems to play most movie formats, image formats, and music formats that I've been able to plug into it.I would have no qualms recommending this product to a friend, and have no regrets for buying it.  For what I was expecting, and for what I paid, I've been blown away.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: J. R. Smith
Reviews.Content: I had spent about 6 weeks researching the various LCD TVs on the market. Granted there are several high end units out there with high end prices. Having purchased the LG 37LD450 about 7 months ago, I wanted another LG. It was coincidence that the LG 42LK520 was a brand new model, just released in March/11. With no previous reviews, I took a chance that this unit would be equal to, or surpass the previous model. I am pleased to state that this LG model has surpassed all my expectations. Well done LG

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: BlueJeansAndRain
Reviews.Content: It's just fancy enough and no fancier. Everything works as advertised and the picture is awesome. The picture adjustment wizard is brilliant. This is also the first 120Hz TV I've owned and I'll never go back. The base is not as solid as I would have expected but it's solid enough and the swivel feature is really nice, specially since it's in an enclosed cabinet it swivels just enough that I can get to the side inputs. The remote is also pretty well designed with buttons for everything I want to get to with one touch. The built-in speakers are not bad for being built-in and the voice amplification feature is a nice touch. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: A very real picture
Reviews.Author: gaspedal
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv at frys. They had a sale so I paid about the same as I would have on amazon.Before this i owned a 50" DLP. I have owned an HD set since before I could get an HD signal.The picture on this set is amazing. This set was made for HD. The level of detail is amazing. I was worried that viewing the set from a distance of about 6 feet would be a problem. Absolutely no problem. Cable can sometimes pixelate but i think that is the result of compression because blue ray does not have the same problem.Anyone who has seen this set seems to make the same comment. They all say "It looks so real it's spooky." Watching Avatar you can easily tell what is CG and what is real. I'm watching Alien as I type. Never got to see the movie in a theatre. All I can say is WOW! Watched it on VHS then on DVD many times over the years. With blu ray on this set it is literally like seeing it again for the first time. Wait until you see the alien pop out of cane's chest!Are there sets as good or better. Maybe but when I saw this one I stopped looking.

Reviews.Title: Great HDTV at a great price
Reviews.Author: Jen K
Reviews.Content: I've had this tv for a couple of weeks now. It has a fantastic picture, comparable in my opinion to the LEDs and plasmas I've looked at, and for much less than an LED. I haven't watched any sports yet but fast action in movies has been smooth. It hooks up to a computer via an HDMI cable very easily and produces a terrific picture with no overscan. The speakers are only acceptable but I hooked it up right away to my sound system via a optical digital cable so I really only use the tv speakers when watching the news or other programs where great sound isn't needed. The Tru Motion feature might work good for sports (I haven't tried it yet but I'll give it a try next hockey game I'm watching) but it is annoying for most other uses b/c of the weird effect it causes (I've read it described as soap opera effect) so I turned it off right away and the picture looks great now. Great HDTV for a great price!

Reviews.Title: First LCD TV
Reviews.Author: E. Scott
Reviews.Content: This is the first LCD TV I have purchased.  Until now I had CRT TVs.  After a long time, I narrowed the choices to LG, Samsung, and Sharp.  I decided on the LG 42LK520 due to various reviews and the price I found on Amazon.  We have been using this TV for three days only, so our experience is limited, but I am pretty happy with the purchase.First, delivery was very fast.  I chose the free Super Saver shipping option (5-8 business days), but the TV was delivered in 3 days.The picture quality is great.  Watching Blu-Ray and DVD movies through an HDMI cable on this LG TV is nothing short of amazing.  Since we had CRT TVs, we had no need for HDTV channels.  However, we may have to upgrade our cable TV service to the HD package.  The quality of the movies might be spoiling us a bit.Sound quality is OK.  To get the full movie experience an external speaker system is needed, but the built-in speakers do an adequate job.The only negative with this TV is the stand.  The stand comes in two parts.  The base unit is plastic with a metal core.  The second part is an adapter that mounts to the TV and the base unit.  This second part is plastic.  When assembled, the stand is not very sturdy.  The TV wobbles rather easily.  Because of this, I am mounting the TV to the wall.  This was not my original plan, but I don't feel comfortable with the TV on the stand.I would rate this TV 5 stars if the stand was more robust.  However, I would recommend this TV to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Glad I did my research
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: I purchased this television from a local retail store that matched the Amazon price.  I did a lot of research before purchasing an LCD HDTV, and I'm glad I went with the LK520.I was looking for a quality 120Hz LCD HDTV in the 42" class with good display adjustments and without clunky "smart" features.  That's exactly what I've found in the LG 42LK520, and I'm very pleased.I'm a photographer and Photoshop enthusiast, and I've done quite a bit of color and contrast calibration.  The picture from my LG 42LK520 is very good, and in addition to several preset modes, you can get very detailed in the fine tuning.  In particular it's worth your time to adjust the Black Level setting.I'm also very pleased with the different "aspect" modes, and the "Just Scan" feature.  I purchased this HDTV in part because of its 120Hz display, but I'm also very pleased that it's easy to turn off.I intentionally wanted to avoid the new generation of "smart" features.  I've heard too many horror stories of HDTVs that take 15 minutes to boot, reboot themselves at random, or take 60 seconds to bring up a menu.  I don't need a TV that streams its own content, there are 5 Netflix capable sources plugged in to my display already!Pros: Great picture and fine tuning controls. 120Hz display, and "Just Scan" mode for gaming. Outstanding 2.4ms response time. Very intuitive and professional feeling menus / UI. No stupid "smart" features. Good price for its class.Cons: I wish I'd bought the larger one. Has fluorescent rather than newer LED backlight.  Slightly higher energy consumption  Slightly lower potential contrast ratio  No possibility for active dynamic contrast adjustment (Only the newest 3D HDTVs offer this anyway).

Reviews.Title: Bad to Awesome! Hook up advice.
Reviews.Author: mountain man
Reviews.Content: If this TV gets a bad rating,then you like me have it hooked up wrong.I set up the tv and connected my old DVD player with RCA jacks (red,white and yellow connectors), and my cable box with (cable company provided HDMI cable). I turned on the cable first and after shutting off energy save and adjusting picture controls,i was extremely dissapointed. I spent hours adjusting settings and looking up TV issues to no avail.Some channels looked just ok but others were unwatchable. I put in a DVD and was not that impressed,again just ok.I purchased this through amazon but i seen it first in a store and loved the picture. I was going to return it but decided to go to the store and ask questions.I told them what TV i had and the two salesman said it was a top of the line model and i should not be having those issues.They explained the HDMI cable provide by the cable company was below average for this type of TV,they said "it was like sucking milk through a coffee straw" the cable cant get all the info to the tv in time.Also the old DVD players dont have 1080 upscalling and i needed to connect another HDMI cable.I found HDMI cables on amazon with high ratings and low price (mediabridge),i also purchased a DVD player with 1080 upscalling,all for less then $100 bucks. So now the moment of truth,i had been watchiing this TV for four days before my cables arrived.I hooked everything up and turned on the TV and OH MY GOD! Blown away.The picture is more then awesome,i could see why alot of movie stars didnt like HD, you can see a drop of sweat as if you were standing next to someone. When i played a movie Gladiator i could not stop watching until it was over.The sound is good enough and loud enough where you dont have to run out and get a stereo system.If you hook this up right you will love it.There is a lot of adjusting thought to get the right colors and skin tone.if anyone is interested i could tel you my settings and you can go from there.my settings are to match the closest skin tones so the people look real.So my advice. get HDMI cables (mediabridge)or one with high ratings for everything you connect to the TV. Upgrade your DVD player (if you want the full picture quaility) to 1080 upscalling wich converts the older movies to 1080 while playing. turn off tru motion and energy saver. Lastly if you plan on using the HDMI cable provided or RCA jacks dont complain about the picture,its not the TV.

Reviews.Title: Great value, no frills HD TV. Perfect for gaming.
Reviews.Author: Harold Hess "Be easy."
Reviews.Content: I was in the market for a new HD TV and didn't want to pay extra for 3D capability or redundant features like wireless internet. I play video games on a fairly competitive level and input lag was a major concern for me. I took my Xbox 360 to a retail seller and was allowed to plug and play to make sure there wouldn't be any issues. I used a HDMI cable and had no problems.More than enough connectivity. I had no problems setting up the TV with the rest of my entertainment system (a sound bar and some gaming systems).Only 2 issues have ever come up:1. Assembling the stand at first was a bit tricky. You have to prop up the face of the TV on some pillows or something to elevate it enough to attach the stand at the bottom since it juts out a bit at the front. A mild inconvenience.2. Review the default settings and make sure to turn off the power-save feature. Otherwise there is a sensor that detects light in the room and it will dim the TV as it gets darker to save power. Maybe there is a way to control just how much it will dim, but I prefer a consistent picture. I almost thought the TV was malfunctioning at first.I have owned this TV for well over 3 months now and have been extremely happy with it. Excellent picture for movies and gaming and no input lag at all. It may not have a host of features like some of the other TVs out there, but I have other devices that I use primarily for internet... etc. This TV is priced very competitively for what it is. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Very Good HDTV
Reviews.Author: Tinker
Reviews.Content: After 24-hours, we're quite happy with this set.A.  Excellent picture quality.  It was good out of the box, and I just finished the Disney calibration, and it's even better, now.  Lighting is even edge-to-edge and corner-to-corner, edges are sharp without jaggies.B.  Very good audio.  We went with the CFL backlighting rather than the LED/LCD because CFL sets tend to have a little more room for internal speakers and therefore, directionally better sound.  This set has good internal speakers and sounds great.The whole plasma/LCD universe is short-term technology, and will be replaced by significantly better technology a long time before the parts in these TV's begin to wear out, so we set a realistic price point and got a much better set than we hoped.It was slightly trickier to assemble the pedestal to the set than it needed to be, but it wasn't hard; just not obvious.  The manual is for about 20 models, and the illustrations weren't all that easy to see.  Still, it only took a couple of head-scratches to figure it out.As much of a geek as I am, it's surprising that this is the first large-screen HDTV we own.  The 30+ year old CRT's work perfectly well, but when the local channels went digital, they also went hi-definition.  I got tired of seeing the center one-half of the shows and bit the bullet.We're casual users, and I take one exception to the advice I received when shopping: don't go by the "How big a TV do you need" charts or advice.  I went by "How tall is the CRT screen I'm replacing?" method and matched that dimension as close as possible.  It's still bigger than we really need, but I'm not trading it in.If, like me, you're just venturing into HDTV, you can't go wrong here.  The next one I buy may be fancier, but this is a whole lot of TV for the dollar.UPDATE (JULY 11, 2011):The HDMI ports failed.  I doubt this is the televison's fault or LG's fault.  This sat in a dark brown truck for 12 hours on a 108-degree day, and was hot to the touch when we opened the box.  It started-up fine and had the great image quality we all talk about, but yesterday, it started to pixellate, and today it won't recognize any device connected through HDMI.It's sad, but like I said: I don't think this is a reflection of the TV's quality, and I will not lower my 5-star rating.In fact, I wouldn't mention it except I just went through the Amazon.com return policy, and they'll take it back, but I had to pay for shipping, insurance and pick-up (it's too big to fit in the car): $70.  Wow!It wasn't sent by a specialy shipper - I see that there are special conditions for returning those items.  Maybe it's because we're returning it and not asking for a replacement at this time.  Why roast another one in the back of a truck?  It made more sense to wait until it cools down in Arizona.Whatever the reason, I was surprised and a little pissed.Great TV, 'though; and I hate to see it go.  Will replace it with the same model when the weather cools down in a few weeks.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV, Excellent Value
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to replace a 32" Vizio LED tv that decided to crap out 8 days into use.This LG TV has already proven its reliabilty is well beyond the Vizio's.  I use this TV almost daily, at least 6 of 7 days each week so its definitely not gathering dust.  I bought this TV for my college dorm room, I was originally worried that a 42" might be too big (having originally gone with a 32") but I think this is right at the limit.What I Like:---Screen; Bigger really is better, at 42 inches you can sit further away while getting the same viewing experience.  Despite being "only and LCD" the screen is exceptionally bright.---Light Sensor; On the lower right corner of the bezel is a light sensor.  Its a great little feature, all you have to do is change picture mode to "intelligent sensor" and it actively adjusts the screen's brightness to match light in the room.  In the grand scheme of things this is a small feature but I find it very useful because we (roommate and I) watch a lot of TV at night so it saves our eyes.---Sound; the speakers (as with most TV's) aren't anything to brag about but can do OK.  I already had a 120W Panasonic Stereo with the appropriate cable so I've been running the sound through that.---Design; this is more broad and more subjective than the other categories.  First the indicator light, some people complain that they can interfere with viewing.  LG decided on a unique "corner light" for this TV (literally, its a backwards "L") and I can say its a good choice.  Its discrete enough while you're watching but still visible enough to give you user feedback when you press a button on the remote.  The bezel on this TV is about 2" and has an interesting thin red outline that runs perpendicular to the viewing angle but is just barely noticeable.  Not necessary at all but it does give the TV an interesting look. It seems to separate the TV from the wall even further, almost like a pop effect rather than direct contrast (black on white).---Value; This TV offers a lot for the $550 range price tag (I paid $551.99 on 8/23/11).  I did extensive research and comparisons before I bought my first TV.  I thought $350 for the 32" Vizio was a great deal so I was skeptical about coughing up an extra 200 but it was worth every penny.I would write what I don't like but I'm hard pressed to find something.  But hopefully I've written something useful for you that's not in LG's description.Bottom Line: I wasn't sure about LG since I consider them a newer TV brand, I still don't see their TV's much these days.  But needless to say they've built a great 1st TV for me and I'm very satisfied.  I will definitely look to LG first when it comes time to buy a new TV.

Reviews.Title: A really great TV!
Reviews.Author: tmar
Reviews.Content: Just as the review title says, its really a great TV!The picture on this TV is just beautiful, the sound is decent enough for an LCD, its got a nice thin body, and the remote is easy to use. I would recommend this to ANYONE looking for a TV. Amazon had the best price by far, much better than any stores.. and the free shipping was cool too. The only thing bad was that UPS was selected as the shipper and left the TV out in front of my house when no one was home. ANYONE could have just walked up and grabbed it, luckily no one did! Im really glad I ordered this TV, after months of shopping for the perfect one I couldnt be happier for the price I paid. I also got the Cheetah Tilting Wall Mount for a good price here and it looks stunning on my bedroom wall.Pros: Everything! STUNNING Picture, great clarity, sound good for an LCD, remote and menus are easy to operate.Cons: Nothing, except that UPS is a bad shipper. I wont dock Amazon or the TV's review for it though!

Reviews.Title: 42LK520 compared to 42LE5400
Reviews.Author: Watermelon Pie
Reviews.Content: Initially, I wanted to compare the LG 42LE5400 42-Inch 1080p 120 Hz LED HDTV with Internet Applications with the LG 42LE5300 42" HD 1080p LED TV with 120Hz, 4 x HDMI and USB connectivity.  Since the 42LE5300 was then out of stock everywhere, I compared the tvs mentioned in the title.With default settings, the 42LE5400 looked much better.  I left the 42LE5400 at default settings and tweaked the 42LK520 to match.  I was amazed at how close I got the two tvs to look.  As they were right next to each other, the LED had a little better contrast, but again, they were super close.  Speakers were about the same.  Both bezels, and packages looked and assembled great.  The 42LE5400 had a little better off angle too, but not until 30 to 40 degrees from center.I found the internet connectivity on the 42LE5400 to be more cumbersome than it was worth.  And our internet would be way to slow to even try Netflix.  So I was bummed I hadn't actually got the 42LE5300.  But I liked the remote on the 42LK520 better, and it was nice not having the extra complexity of internet stuff in the menus.Even though the 42LE5400 was 800 dollars and the 42LK520 was 668 dollars, both from Walmart, I went with the LED tv.  Besides the slight edge bleeding from edge-lit LED, and my opinion of the useless internet connectivity, I thought the picture was just slightly better.  I mean, I could have gotten a blu-ray player with the LK for the same price.  The fact the LE5400 was marked down and the LK520 was regular price also could have played into my bargain purchasing mentality.But the 42LK520 is a GREAT tv for the price.  From what I can remember,I put the backlight all the way up.Contrast all the way up.Brightness to around 60%.I shifted the color more to the cool side.I would highly recommend this tv, especially when it goes on sale.

Reviews.Title: Wow,  What a value!
Reviews.Author: Joe Gump "Joe Gump"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV at great price.  But, if I had gotten it at Amazon I would have gotten free shipping and saved $40.  Plus, I'd have the Amazon Guarantee.  Oh well. I wanted the best 55 inch experience for the buck.  No Smart TV (I can hook my iPad and have a 55" touch screen).  No 3D, it looked great, but still expensive.  Plus the software doesn't exist if you are not a gamer.  No LCD, a  budget buster.  I haven't seen many big screens, but I have to say when watching a BluRay I have never seen anything so sharp, almost 3D.  So bottom line.  This TV is the highest rated (see predecessor 55 LD 520) no frill TV by a great manufacturer.  I'm very pleased!!!My only gripe is the LG TV doesn't talk to my new Sony BluRay.  I spoke with LG and Sony, neither had a solution.  With hdmi cables these manufacturers shouldn't use proprietary codes so we have to buy all one manufacturer.  If you buy the LG TV get their wall mount.  Very slick.

Reviews.Title: Picture surpasses many LED TVs.
Reviews.Author: Ed Travis
Reviews.Content: 'll keep this simple and save you from doing the homework. This is an upgrade from a 32" LG and it's picture quality impressed me to the point that I couldn't see paying an extra $300 for an LED screen. Gaming is great on Xbox and PS3. Also there is no need to worry about all the lighting (edge vs full array) issues you read about with low end LED's. Black levels are more than acceptable and colors are not overly saturated. Just Google this model and find all the positive reviews for yourself or just trust me on this one!

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: S. Robertson
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV after reading all the reviews on Amazon's site, as well as reviews on other sites...favorable and not-so-favorable.I'm not going to go into all the technical details others did, as I am not a very technical person. But, I am VERY happy with this TV.The base attached quickly and easily...no problem with mismatched holes. The bottom of the box WAS a little torn up, but UPS said to let them know if anything was not as it should be and they would take care of it. Thanks to the packaging of the TV, it was fine.Hooking up my satellite feed, Xbox, and DVD player(s) was a cinch, as there are more connections than stated in the description. I was then able to set the TV so I can choose which feed I want to use at any particular time.The picture is amazing! Settings can be changed to your preferences for brightness and picture size. None of the settings are permanent, so you can't make irreparable mistakes.As to the sound, I really cannot understand what people are complaining about. I've never had surround sound, so maybe that's the difference. I have had no problem with not being able to hear the sound. Like a lot of TV's (and DVD's) it seems to depend on the program.All in all, I would recommend this to my family and friends. I couldn't be happier!

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: T. Daniels
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with the LG 55LK520.  There are TVs that perform better than this, but I believe you need to pay several hundred dollars more.  This panel display blacks as very dark over all areas of the screen.  The contrast of various levels of black could be better, but compares favorably with other TVs at this price point.Colors are very vibrant and bright.  Note that the default picture setting is overly bright with the color being too `hot'.  Before I took the time to fine tune the picture, I simply moved to the stock `Cinema' mode and bumped up the brightness a bit for a solid general-use picture.  This display performs very well with XBox games over HDMI.The side-viewing angle is a bit less here than other models, but is definitely adequate for my room.  The matte screen has very low reflectivity so is excellent for bright rooms.As mentioned in other reviews, there is a piece of thin red trim around the outer edge of the bezel.  I don't feel this improves the appearance of the bezel, but is only noticeable from the side.The mounting bracket supplied by my TV stand, Z-Line Vitoria Flat Panel TV Stand, blocks access to the rear component video inputs.  I don't know whether this is caused by a non-standard mount, or the TV's placement of the inputs.  The HDMI and VGA inputs are fully accessible.I personally find no reason to own the gimmicks found on more expensive televisions.  3D may be cool for the rare movie that implements it nicely, but ask yourself how often are you going to want to sit around with glasses on.  If you want to view internet content, buy separately a Blu-ray player or Xbox.  If you simply want an excellent picture, this is a great product to consider.

Reviews.Title: Best Television In Its Class
Reviews.Author: smistephen
Reviews.Content: The guidelines say I should refrain from using "inappropriate language", so I'll just say: Holy cr...iminy this is an awesome TV.Relatively easy to construct (screw stand together, screw stand to TV, 4 Philips each)  and extraordinarily easy to configure (a simple wizard at first startup for basic info like timezone, and then a 5-step picture tuner), and gorgeous-looking on your table or wall :)I read some reviews that made TruMotion seem like the work of the devil, but it's not really that bad in small doses. Turn it on Low for normal TV, and High for sports and other fast-moving scenes.The remote is plain, but does its job well - the buttons are solid and the whole thing is well-constructed.. It's a TV remote control, not a work of art, and it comes batteries included. That is enough for me, haha.The main seller for me? USB connection. If you want to play things from your computer on your TV, but don't want to mess around with cables and configurations and such, just drag and drop the file onto a USB drive or key, stick it in the side, and use the extraordinarily well-designed and intuitive media player (great 10-foot design here from LG, big congratulations).That said, if you want to connect your computer, or anything else, it has VGA, a standard computer audio in, DVI, plenty of HDMI, component, RGB, digital audio out for the best quality, and a headphone jack, which is becoming less common these days.The screen is beautiful, no glare (I have this set up next to a large floor-to-ceiling window that gets full morning sun, and watched the news this morning no trouble) and the bezel has a red trim running along the very edge that I thought added a touch of LG class :) Not to mention it comes with a free cleaning cloth.The onboard speakers are great, I'm no audiophile but I can't see a need for external speakers unless you wanted to rig up an elaborate Dolby system or something. It has an interesting feature called ClearVoice II that somehow detects sounds at the frequency of the human voice and amplifies them, which is great I think, as oftentimes voices can blend in with music or other noise onscreen.All in all, this TV is everything you want, and more. It has all the good stuff, and cuts out all the random useless criminy to save you money. BUY IT. - Steve

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Picture!
Reviews.Author: EricEst1978
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV from Best Buy, or rather exchanged the 47in. Insignia (model NS-46E790A12) for this TV.At the time of this review, both TV's were priced at $649.  The picture quality of the LG LCD is exponentially better than the aforementioned Insignia LED.The picture wizard is a breeze for calibrating the settings, and I really can't say enough about how beautiful, and crisp the picture quality is on this television.We went in to Best Buy with the intent of purchasing this television initially, but opted for the insignia because it was larger, and had newer (LED) technology.  After setting the Insignia TV up at home, and spending a ton of time tweaking the settings (using THX optimizer, etc.) the picture quality just felt like it was lacking.  It seemed a little washed out, and the picture just wasn't as vivid, and crisp as we had imagined it should be.We boxed it back up, and exchanged it for the LG, and every single expectation was exceeded with respect to picture quality.  We had purchased a Boston Acoustics sound bar with the Insignia, and hooked it up right away with the LG so I can't really comment on the sound quality of the TV alone.I've seen a few complaints about the stand--I haven't experienced any abnormal sloppiness, or flimsiness with the stand, and the fact that it swivels is a bonus as it accomodates the seating in our living room nicely.All together-- (based on my first impressions) I have no complaints whatsoever about this TV. Easy set-up, very nice interface/menus, picture wizard is intuitive, and works fantastically, and the picture is flawless.If you are in the market for a new TV, the 42LK520 is a fantastic option.  I would absolutely recommend this TV to my friends, family, coworkers etc.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING TV THAT DOES THE JOB!!!
Reviews.Author: MvaVegeta
Reviews.Content: This is my first time with a LG 55" LCD TV (or even a big screen TV at that). I wanted to build my own home theater center and succeeded with this TV! I have this big boy hooked up to SOOO MANY THINGS!For starters, I have the HD cable box on it, Sony home theater surround sound system, Sony Blu-ray and DVD player, also a Sony VHS/DVD player combo, Sony PS1, PS2 & PS3, Sony PSP 2000 through a component cable. More items include: Microsoft Xbox and an Xbox 360, Nintendo NES, Super Nintendo SNES, N64, Nintendo GameCube, Wii. More include: Sega master system, genesis, Sega cd, 32X, Saturn, Dreamcast, JVC X-eye and finally my laptop. With all that said, I have an audio/video switch box, component video switchbox and a HDMI switchbox.Clearly I need a lot of inputs and the TV does deliver at least 2 sets of each input for performance and convenience but I stepped it up a notch to make it even more convenient. The remote to this TV is easy to navigate through other inputs as well.The TV's quality on each and every system is great! HD and true-motion on this TV looks SUPER SWEET! Clarity on the old school systems are at a decent  to above average quality, considering HD wasn't a factor back then, but NES and Genesis to me on this TV look great! Normal 4:3 or wide/stretch 16:9 ratios with the old gaming systems look great as well.Switching between inputs is fast, and the TV's performance has little-to-none ghosting on cable TV. Also being able to control and even disable the TV's energy saving sensor is great. Even though that feature is useless to me, but great to have in case, it's good that you can turn it off. It does become in an inconvenience when the TV has a mind of its own and starts dimming the picture A LOT. So I deactivated that feature entirely.Sound on this TV is good stand alone. It could use a little more but for what it is, it's great. If you have this TV hooked up to surround sound, then you should be fine, I use mine more than the regular TV speaker itself. One thing that bothers me is having the TV's speaker high up and your surround sound on with it at the same time. There is a delay in sound and you can hear an echo with it. I have fixed this by lowering the TV's volume to about level 10 or 9, and jack up the surround sound system a lot. So no biggie here... NOTE: the surround sound is connected with an audio optical cable. I'm sure there are other ways to actually fix/calibrate this, rather than do it the way I did, but for now I am satisfied.Overall this TV delivers great and amazing results. I would recommend this to anyone. The quality and clarity of DVDs and Blu-ray discs on this TV are so great; it might as well be a 3D TV. Anyone who is a hardcore video gamer like me, I love this TV and would definitely recommend this TV for old and new school video game systems. For anyone looking for just cable tv, it is great! DVD and Blu-ray is perfect! Amazing job on this TV LG!

Reviews.Title: BAD ASS LG
Reviews.Author: BROWNING
Reviews.Content: This is by far the sickest TV out there for under a 1000 bucks. Don't waist your money on the 240 hz when the 120hz is just as clear and 10 billion times cheaper!!! For gaming its unreal and super responsive!! The sound on it is pretty decent but I hooked up a LG blue ray surround sound to it and watched 300 the other night and it was perfect never seen anything like it didn't really have to calibrate much just set it on auto lighting an it looks good enough for me!! Also it doesn't jack your energy bill up much really at all maybe 10 bucks more at the max per month but thats it!! If your looking for a sick TV without ripping a hole in your underwear get this!! I would say it is easily the Alpha TV being the LG over all the other brands in its category!

Reviews.Title: Love It !!!
Reviews.Author: Cyndy
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this tv and wanted to wait a few weeks before writing a review. I am VERY pleased with my tv! It was easy to set up, no need to adjust anything, it had a crisp and clear picture as soon as I turned it on.  I did a lot of research on big screen tvs and found that LG has a good reputation for making a quality product and I agree.  I debated on upgrading but after alls said and done I am very glad I did!!

Reviews.Title: The best tv deal
Reviews.Author: jung
Reviews.Content: First time I brought samsung 40" LED TV, however it had a big screen trouble within 3 days.What's wrong samsung. Who said samsung is the best TV manufacturing company.I returned it (it's not easy to returned it for its size and weight). After then I did start research again for what kinds of TV is the best for my house. I will not hang TV on the wall and want bigger size in my budget and I figured that there are not much difference between LED and LCD. I brought LG LK520 and I am really glad to choose it for reasonable price, screen size, picture quality, sound and every things.Believe me you cannot find any differences the picture quality between LED and LCD if you do not need hang TV on the wall.Technology is going fast and do not think LED (the lastest version of TV model) is best TV model in few years.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product So Far, Good Price, Missing Screws
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: Got this in yesterday finally.Initial thought was: the box had already been opened and resealed, however upon further inspection, I found a sticker on the box from Paul's TV that says for the shipping receiver to inspect the product for damage before receiving it.  Understandable, as this protects both the customer and the seller.Got it home, took everything out of the box to find out that it didn't come with the screws required to mount on the stand.  Nothing a 15 minute trip to Lowe's and $4 out of my pocket couldn't cure.  A minor inconvenience, if anything.I actually don't have any true 1080p setups yet, however I tried a few different things.  First was connecting to my PC via DVI-to-HDMI cord.  This broadcast in 1080i for some reason, and you might have to readjust the brightness/resolution for it to show up properly.  Next I tried my Gamecube on it.  The Cube's native resolution is something like 480i, however at 120Hz, the fluidity of everything made it look amazing.  Lastly was an old LOTR DVD.  Again, not HD, however the refresh rate makes everything look like it's running at a higher fps almost.  Almost to the extent of looking fake/like someone was shooting the scene with a home movie camcorder.  Nothing too huge to complain about at all though.All in all, for the price, I'm extremely happy.  If I'm this happy running sub-HD content on this baby, I don't think I'll have any problems with Blu-rays or gaming in the future.

Reviews.Title: Love this tv!
Reviews.Author: Shana "That's my opinion- I could be wrong!"
Reviews.Content: Of all the flat screen TV's I've owned (Sony, Vizio, Samsung)this LG is my favorite. The picture quality is excellent and very vivid. The sound quality is excellent too, when I listen to music on this or play video games on this I crank the volume and it's like having a mini stereo playing. I'm not technical so I can't describe all of this TV's attributes, but, it's easy to use and to hook up componants like the Wii, PS, dvd player, etc.The styling of this tv is clean and sleek and looks great with about any decor. I'd highly recommend.The delivery crew set my tv up but, they didn't hook up anything.

Reviews.Title: Great clarity but void of reproducing  ACCURATE colors in live action pictures.
Reviews.Author: Kirk T.
Reviews.Content: Before I jump into it, please allow me to explain a bit about myself (1) and my short experience with this TV (2) and finally, why I am giving it only 2 stars based on my impressions and opinion (3).1)  I work in graphic design and photo editing for a very well known brand and I spend a large portion of my day in front of various computer screens and tv monitors creating artwork/editing photos.  With that said, I should know all of the differences available when shopping around for a TV and I should have done a bit more research for my particular needs.  I knew an LCD with LED backlighting is what I prefer but the amazing reviews on this LCD (with standard fluorescent lighting) convinced me otherwise.  I should have gone with my gut feeling on an LED screen instead and I'll tell you why in a bit.2)  I received the TV yesterday.  I can't speak highly enough about Amazon's handling of my order.  It was the first time I ever purchased an item this large (or expensive) even though I have easily spent THOUSANDS on Amazon.com over the last few years.  It arrived promptly (I ordered on Friday, received on Tuesday with FREE SHIPPING) and in excellent NEW condition.  I unboxed it and took about 10-15 minutes to set it up.  It was very easy -- the Picture Wizard setting made it a breeze and having prior experience with my room mates LG tv,  these settings were really a breeze for me.  I adjusted them for the most true-to-life picture, or so I thought (more on that in a bit).  The TV itself is few-frills but has ample settings and a simple and very easy to navigate interface.  I set it to my liking and immediately tried out cable, a blu ray and even a PS3 game.3)  The outcome was as follows:  This set produces a VERY clear picture.  It is vibrant and bright with its great contrast ratio and I didn't have any issues with black levels as some people here have mentioned.  So why am I giving it only 2 stars?  Color accuracy.  My room mates have a nearly identical set that is LED backlit and the difference in color reproduction is NIGHT AND DAY.  I really convinced myself that the difference between LCD and LED was minimal, since they are both technically different types of LCD with different methods of lighting.  Let me assure you that THERE IS A CLEAR DIFFERENCE and I have seen it with my own eyes.  I have decided to return this TV because I found the colors not only inaccurate, but also plagued by a yellow highlight effect, particularly noticeable when looking at lighter skin tones.  The whites also seem off-white and this set sufferers from what is commonly referred to as the "dirty screen" effect. In other words, areas that are intended to be flat/bright white actually appear to have artifacts or a sort of 'dingy' attribute that is not intended.  Also, rright fades from one light color to another [darker] variation often reveal a gradient effect that is unintended and it really takes away from the viewing experience.Overall, my thoughts are as follows:  This is a great set for someone who doesn't know what to look for.  The screen is clear, vibrant and offers clarity that is above average in its price range.  The sound is decent, which is something most modern flatscreens are missing and the settings are more than enough for a day to day user who doesn't require too much tweaking.  The TV seems well made and though some have complained about the shaky stand, I can assure you this is how almost all modern flatscreens are constructed so good luck finding something better.  If I weren't me - and didn't know what I know or have seen what i've seen in my line of work, my complaint might seem invalid and this set would be worth a solid 4 stars based on all other factors combined with not having an eye for this sort of thing.  Video games  truly looked great as did Disney cartoons and they were simply fantastic.  If you have this set, all you have to do is turn on Toy Story 3 with Trumotion and sit in awe of its vibrancy.Aside from great gaming and cartoons this set really falls short in the live action realm.  Because I am in a position to know the differences in color reproduction (AND I'M PICKY) and I can tell you with confidence the weak point of this TV is the color accuracy.  If you are someone who really cares about good quality picture reproduction, this simply isn't the set that is going to give it to you.I hope my review makes sense and helps some of you make the best decision for YOU.  I really think this set is deserving of a 4 or 5 star rating as some of you have given, but for me I can't give it more than 2 stars having a keen eye for color and realism.  On the plus side, I have never had to return anything to Amazon in the past and this time I am going to.  Amazon has been absolutely great to work with and have arranged to have UPS pick the package up for me at my home and expedite a return.  I will likely use them again for a different TV purchase, but not for an exchange of the same set.  Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: Incredible picture, great price
Reviews.Author: C. Myers
Reviews.Content: Just received this TV last weekend, upgrading from a 32" 60Hz Samsung unit in the bedroom to this one, and I have to say it's incredible.  The picture is amazing, setup was very easy, and the difference in quality (maybe due to the refresh rate) is very real -- surprisingly so.  At this price point, this is a great product.

Reviews.Title: LG 42" LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: AJ
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV.  I purchased two other TVs (Vizio and Hitachi) and I had to return both of them. I was looking for the cheapest 40" TV but I also got the cheapest quality.  After I started thinking about wathing these TVs for the next 5 years I decided to return them.  Please don't ever buy a TV for the price, buy it for the quality.  I know an extra $200 is a lot of money but if you think that's only an extra $0.11 per day, it's not that bad.  The picture quality of this LG is perfect.  Don't forget to turn off the energy saving setting on this TV. It makes it very dark depending on the light in your room. One you turn that off, you will think this is the best money you ever spent.

Reviews.Title: Great Television!!!!
Reviews.Author: D. Bennett "DB"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this television (47") six months ago. My decision was based on price, reviews, and the availability of a 5 year manufacturer's warranty available on Amazon. I have never regretted my decision. The picture is beautiful and it's perfect for my needs. No it doesn't have all the apps that other televisions have, but with those apps available on my bluray player and X-box, I don't really need them on my television as well. Other reviews I read complained about the quality of the stand. Is it made of metal or some other solid material? No. But, there is nothing wrong with it either. It does what it's suppose to do very well and that is simply to hold the television.The only thing I will suggest (as other reviews have suggested as well) is that you turn off the power savings setting. The resulting variation of screen brightness is very annoying. Once that setting is off, the picture is crystal clear...I absolutely love watching HD television and bluray movies on this set!

Reviews.Title: Predicted quality, and got it!
Reviews.Author: Jon
Reviews.Content: Maybe it's because we went from a tube TV to this, but I love this TV. The setup was extremely easy (you do need two people to lift the TV and assemble the stand though) and the picture is great. I'm very pleased with this purchase. The price was right and it's a huge screen! Some reviews mention the sound; while I do agree that it isn't the BEST quality, it works just fine for a family of four who aren't too picky. The only "negative" thing I can say is that you will need to get an HDMI cable in order to enjoy the full 1080p. Everything else about this TV is wonderful. Easy menu interface, sleek design, great picture (detail and contrast), fast and easy setup, and of course the price!

Reviews.Title: Amazing HDTV - a GREAT buy!
Reviews.Author: Ross770
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to begin this review, other than by saying we couldn't be happier with this new LG 47" HDTV. We've had it for about a month now, and we love it. I was a bit OCD in picking out a new TV, as this is my first HDTV, and I literally spent weeks doing the research, running around the stores to see the floor models, and making a final decision on this TV.  Here is some feedback on specific areas:Picture:- The picture quality of this 47" LCD is amazing when viewing programs in 1080 resolution (our cable box sends a 1080i signal for HD programming, and that is the majority of the programming we watch). It does leave a little something to be said for viewing SD programming (480i) on this large TV, BUT you can adjust a setting on the Picture menu to have the TV automatically adjust the screen's aspect ratio depending on the signal (1080 vs. 480), and that helps. The TV will then automatically "shrink" the viewable screen size to make SD programs more viewable (less blurry, fuzzy, etc.).- Energy Saver: The TV comes factory set with the Energy Saver on Auto, and this is not a setting I recommend. Using the enrgy saver at anything higher than medium makes the screen extremely dark, and results in an unpleasant viewing experience. We have it set to Low, and that works fine (you can also turn it off completely).- I like that there are multiple options for the type of programming I'm watching, such as Standard, Sport, Cinema, Game, and Vivid. I've tried switching from Standard to Sport when watching football, as well as turning the TruMotion setting to high, and this makes watching sports amazing (as you can really follow the fast-action clearly and without blur from screen-refresh).- The picture color is absolutely stunning. We were watching Survivor in HD last week and actually felt like we were sitting in paradise on the beach. Every time we turn the TV on and pull something up in HD, I comment to my wife how amazing the color and picture quality are. We have not tried gaming or using a Blu-Ray player yet, so I cannot comment on the quality there, but I don't doubt it will be just as amazing.Audio:One of my initial concerns based on reading the reviews on all HDTVs was the poor audio quality from small speakers. BUT, I have to say that the audio quality on this TV is actually really good. I thought that I was going to need a separate soundbar or sound system, but I am putting that on hold because the speakers built into this TV do a really good job, and I have NO complaints about the audio.Installation:The TV came well packaged and was easy to get out of the box and laid out on the floor. The directions for attaching the stand to the bottom/back of the TV could be a little clearer, but we got the job done. My only complaint is that if you're trying to attach the stand while the TV is lying flat on the floor, it's not gonna happen. This was a 2-person job, because one person had to hold the TV up at an angle so the other person could screw on the stand (as the stand extends out to the front of the TV and thus is not attachable when the TV is flat on the ground). I might recommend laying it on the edge of a bed so you can attach the stand easier without lifting it awkwardly. After that, it was quite easy to lift and position on the entertainment center.Setup was a bit confusing, as I did not initially realize that when hooking it up to a cable box via HDMI, you need to change the Input setting (via the remote) to HDMI. I stupidly sat there for 20 minutes trying to get the TV to program itself and the channels in the default TV mode. But when I finally switched to the HDMI Input mode, the signal from the cable box was immediate. Don't be stupid like me!Bottom line: We love this TV and I would definitely recommend it. Granted, it doesn't have all the bells and whistles that other, more expensive TV's have (3-D, Internet, etc.), BUT it more than makes up for it with picture quality (and truth is that the picture quality on some of those fancier TV's is pretty awful).  A great buy!

Reviews.Title: Don't send back until you play with the settings!
Reviews.Author: ct
Reviews.Content: We read the great reviews and chose this tv for our kid's playroom...we put it up and couldn't believe that it got such great reviews - the picture quality seemed terrible.  We went back and read the suggestions and the problem was the "energy setting"... turn OFF that setting and you will not believe the difference in the picture quality.  So...before you take it down and send it back...play around with the different settings on the TV...the first one being turning off the "energy saver".

Reviews.Title: Amazon Verified Purchase
Reviews.Author: cromfan
Reviews.Content: We chose this TV because it was very well rated by Consumer Reports and because we had seen a floor model on sale at a competitor's and found the picture better than the other sets on the floor.  However, it was used and selling for more than the price at Amazon.  We ordered online and it arrived less than a week later. I hooked it up.  We had the cable service come in two days later to make sure that we were getting all of the HD channels that we were paying for.  The reception is excellent and the sound is not too bad for built in speakers, but we will be adding an external amplifier and speakers for movies.  It is easy to switch from one input to another.  We have watched all types of programs from series to sports to dvd films and enjoyed this unit very much.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Wayne Fitzgerald
Reviews.Content: We already have a 3 year old LG downstairs that still looks great. Decided to get another for upstairs. After considerable research, decided on this one. The picture is great. I was hoping that the TV sound would be better than the other LG, and it is, we don't have a surround system for this tv. I am surprised there is no audio out jacks on it, but if you're going to connect it to a sound system you should use the audio outs from the cable/satellite/converter box anyway. The older LG has audio outs but we don't use them. Some reviewers complained about the mount being flimsy, I don't think it is a problem. We have it upstairs where the floor is not as stable as a basement floor, but it doesn't wobble when you walk across the room.The free shipping from Amazon was great, I ordered on Tuesday night and received the tv on Friday!

Reviews.Title: great tv!
Reviews.Author: colleen wedemeyer
Reviews.Content: first, i must give amazon 5 stars too!! ordered the tv on thanksgiving at around 9:30pm with an estimated delivery date of tues. was amazed when it was delivered at 9:30 am today(sat.)!! set up was a breeze and we watched the osu vs michigan game in sports mode by noon! we had a 32"hdtv before this one with 1080p but this set is great. still tweaking the different options for the best pic but even without the tweaks it's great. have no problems with the stand quality- doesn't wobble. remote is like any other remote-fairly easy to use. sound is good! was a little worried from other reviews but is absolutely not a problem. did turn off the energy saver mode as per other reviews. i recommend this hdtv highly and think amazon's service is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: I am not disappointed
Reviews.Author: Warren Sproul
Reviews.Content: Just received and set up my new LG 42LK420. I did a lot personal research and read quite a few customer reviews (on Amazon and elsewhere) all of which indicated that this 42 inch LCD TV was a really good one. They were wrong... it is an excellent TV. I am NOT disappointed in my selection. Short and sweet the picture is great even stunning when viewing true 1080p broadcasts and/or blu-ray media. This is not a 3D TV but the TV is so clear and sharp that (for example) some scenes in AVATAR seemed to jump right off the screen. Sports, prime time programming, even the nightly news are all brilliant... again when broadcast in true 1080 HD quality. This TV comes with internal picture calibration which allows the viewer/user to fine tune dare I say super tune the image to exact personal preferences. Standard/preset adjustments are available too but I found using the calibration settings by far achieved the best result. The 120Hz refresh rate means no blurred motion when watching sports/action programs. The sound isn't bad either... i.e. using the TV itself no external speaker i.e. home theater system. If you want to hook up to external/home theater audio you can via optical connection. This unit also has a very good internal tuner for those who want to receive over the air HD broadcasting using an outside antenna. Again the picture quality is excellent for prime time HD broadcasts and the tuner pulls in a surprising number of channels. I got 32 in the Cincinnati area. This TV is not the newer LED/LCD version so it's not as thin and theoretically not as bright nor sharp. In the store nor at home I can't tell the difference at least concerning picture quality. It does not have 'smart' internet capability and again no 3D. I mounted my set on the stand and not on the wall. This TV is big and heavy enough to produce an unavoidable but small wobble when stand mounted. An anchor screw is provided to fasten and so secure the stand and TV to any surface it is on though this is not a realistic option for a finished/fine furniture surface. As such it should be located in a corner or up against a wall and not in an open area where it might get an errant bump. If you have kids get it deep in the corner or better yet... up on a wall. At around $600 this, in my mind, is a terrific value for what I want out of flat screen HD TV... which is... to watch it. Hope this helps. If you get one you'll the SEE what I mean

Reviews.Title: Great picture out of the box
Reviews.Author: David256
Reviews.Content: This TV has excellent picture quality right out of the box, but also has many options for adjustments to tweak it to your liking. I have tested it with Playstation 3 and Xbox 360 and with game mode there is no noticeable lag and they look great on it. Blu-Rays on PS3 with 24 Hz set to ON look fantastic( not all video outputs 24Hz) hit the TV info button to check what the video is being output to. For the price this is one of the best deals on LCD TVs out there.. With 3 HDMI ports and 2 Componant ports you should be good to go. We have a highly rated Panasonic Plasma Viera a couple years old and I like this LG picture slightly more, plus I wanted an LCD since the room it was going to be in had more sunlight which LCD look better in and it will be used for games so image retention and burnin are much less a worry on LCDs.  Only negatives the stand is kind if cheaply made, it does it's job if you you don't plan on moving it around a lot, though you can tilt it slightly without too much worry.  Also of notice if you view this TV from many different angles or standing up the picture quality isn't as nice as the Plasma, but as long as you have a direct view sitting down I think it surpasses the some if the best Plasmas, great for bedrooms not so great for living room if you have many people watching from many different angles.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tv!
Reviews.Author: Nancy
Reviews.Content: Just received the LG 42LK520 TV from Amazon. I researched 42 inch LCD tv's heavily on Amazon, and other sites, and visited tv's at Best Buy. I cannot imagine doing any better , price and size-wise, than I did with this purchase. Fantastic image, easy set up. Bought the $8 HDMI cable for the TV + cable box connection, and am thrilled with that too. Many good reviews for this tv on Amazon; I was not steered the wrong way. Free shipping was icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: perfect picture!
Reviews.Author: golfer
Reviews.Content: We researched this t.v. before purchasing and are not disappointed.  The picture is beautiful.  The only issue we had was that in the evening the picture darkened some.  We called LG.  They told us that this was an energy saving option and walked us through the procedure to disconnect this option.  Would highly recommend this t.v. to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Daphne F.
Reviews.Content: We got the 42" TV for in our very sunny saloon.  It works well even with high light in the room.  After reading the other reviews, we turned off the energy saver.  The speakers are ok on their own, but most folks who use this as a main TV will want to add a sound bar or bass/home-theater system.What I liked best were the 3 HDMI inputs.  We are able to use this as our "receiver", and then have an optical audio output going to the old Onkyo receiver/speaker-sound-system.  That way, we don't have to pick up a mess of different remotes to switch between different inputs for the TV, then separately for the sound system.  TOTAL HOOKUPS: 2 component inputs (RGB/WR), 2 AV inputs (RWY), a coaxial input, a 15-pin RGB input (for PC) with a ?mic jack RBG/DVI audio in, some weird RS-232C input (for control and setup, it says), the 3 HDMI's, and an optical audio output.The power cord is short, if you're hanging on the wall, get an extension cord like this one: Coleman Cable 3531 14/3 General-Use Appliance Extension Cord, 3-Foot.We put it up using this very heavy duty hanging system, and it looks great! : VideoSecu Articulating Full Motion TV Wall Mount for Large LED LCD Plasma TVs, Dual Arm pulls out up to 25 Inch, with Leveling Adjustments, Free HDMI Cable A37Cable management via easy to install in-the-wall system using these two items: Arlington LV2-1 2-Gang Low Voltage Mounting Bracket, 1-Pack and DataComm 45-0002-WH 2-Gang Recessed Low Voltage Cable Plate (White) (if you buy two of each, one for top and one for bottom, you can put a whole mess of wires through them.)

Reviews.Title: Fantastic "Basic" HDTV
Reviews.Author: Ashton P. Johnson "Zepaw"
Reviews.Content: So many TVs out there with bells-and-whistles like 3D and Apps. I was looking for a large and vivid TV mostly for playing xbox (read Black Ops). I have no interest in 3D TV and the TVs with internet apps like Netflix would be tempting but my Xbox can do most of that. This is exactly what I wanted. I got it from Amazon's Warehouse Deals and I am glad I did. Saved a pile and it is like new.It is the perfect size for my small/mid-sized apartment. A great buy all around.

Reviews.Title: LG 55LK520
Reviews.Author: Ralph
Reviews.Content: All the reviews covered most of the details, so there's no need to cover them again. After the first hour of viewing, we were extremely pleased with the 55LK520 HDTV.Update: We are returning the 55LK520 due to a DSE problem (dirty screen effect). This is a defect in the screen panel that is noticeable when the camera pans across the screen, and only when viewing a lightly colored background scene. Watching a hockey game really makes this problem stand out. It's like watching a moving object through a blotchy smudged window. It's not something you can clean on the viewer side of the screen and is inside the screen layer or layers.

Reviews.Title: Dirty Screen Spoils Sports
Reviews.Author: tbone
Reviews.Content: This TV has a lot going for it but unfortunately I got one with the "dirty screen effect" that has been noted in Amazon and AVS forum reviews. The set had the supposedly preferred S-IPS panel but there was a graininess to the picture when the camera panned over light backgrounds that was especially noticeable during sporting events. There was also a small light smudge in the main viewing area that gave the the impression it was moving along with the camera.There is some discussion that the problem could be caused by a anti-glare coating. While the coating reduces glare, it can sometimes cause grainy and smudge-like effects in the way it affects light produced by the backlight, especially with light colors. It's like a coating was applied with a cheap brush. I don't know if this is the case with this model, but it accurately describes the issues I saw. The odd thing is the problem is not visible when the camera is still or with a dark background and unless you watch sports, you might not notice it at all.I contacted LG and they are aware of the issue. However, their fix was to turn off the Tru-Motion 120hz feature and the Energy saver in all viewing modes. First, I had already tried that and it didn't work. Second, turning off Tru-Motion means you no longer have a 120hz set, which was not a viable alternative. So I decided to return the TV.The HD picture was very good to excellent and I would have kept the TV if that also applied to sports programming. The SD picture was very poor. If you care about design, the bezel around the panel is noticeably wider than other TVs (2.25") and very glossy to the point where it was sometimes distracting while viewing in a bright room and it also gives it a dated look. There is a headphone jack but it cuts out all other sound output so you have to manually unplug it when not in use. The sound for normal programming was very good as was the menu system and versatility it offers.It would be easy to give this a good rating if not for the dirty screen effect. However, since this issue is not uncommon and LG is aware of it, I did not consider replacing with the same model. I know there are a lot of happy owners of this set and it appears that like with a lot of HDTV's, getting a good one is the luck of the draw.

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture - my only complaint was poor setup instructions
Reviews.Author: D. Hines
Reviews.Content: Full disclosure: I got one of these in the great Best Buy New Year's Eve website price mistake fiasco, so the fact that I paid just over two hundred bucks for mine may be coloring my review somewhat.This TV has great features and a fantastic picture.  My only real complaint was the lousy setup instructions.  It's one of those deals where they try to make one manual work for every model they sell, so you do a lot of looking around for the information you need.  It's also poorly explained and illustrated, making it somewhat tough to figure out how to put the darn thing on the stand.  The only other thing I didn't like was the lack of any audio output jack other than one of those TOSlink things.  Would have been nice to have a headphone jack to make it easier to hook up external speakers/amps.  (UPDATE: thanks to commenter M. Duhamel for pointing out that this TV does indeed have a headphone jack on the side panel.  I must be getting blind in my old age, because I missed it completely) The onboard sound is OK, but it's nothing to write home about.  I figure I'll probably wind up buying one of those home theater sound systems that have TOSlink built in.GREAT connectivity - 3 HDMI ports, two component video inputs, two composite video inputs, VGA input so you can connect a computer.  Also has a USB port that allows you to display photos or videos on the TV by inserting a thumb drive or connecting an external hard drive. (may have issues with some less common CODECs)All in all, a very nice TV.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Michael Smith "Michael Smith"
Reviews.Content: Quite a few folks have given detailed reviews of the LG520 so I'm not going to reinvent the wheel.  I read many of their reviews before deciding to purchase the LG520.  This is an excellent TV and is easy to install.  It took me about 20-30 minutes to go from box to watching TV.  Our TV is located above our fireplace and it was easy enough to lift the TV on my own and place it in it's new home.  Unlike many we only have (1) RCA for our DVD/VCR and (1) HDMI connection for our TIVO.  The picture quality is excellent.  You'll need to find the setting you like best and go with it.  Light from the adjacent window in our family room has no impact on screen quality.  The sound quality is very good too.  There are quite a few YouTube videos that demonstrate setup as well as walk you through recommended configuration.  They are worth viewing if this is your first large screen TV.  (this was ours).  Amazon delivered the TV in less than 5 days.  I went ahead and purchased the LG 5 year warranty even though these almost always end up being money down the drain.  It's just too big a purchase not to have a little insurance on it.  I would also recommend placing an inexpensive UPS on all of your major electronics.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV!
Reviews.Content: LG 42LK520 42-Inch 1080p 120 Hz LCD HDTV Ordered 2 of these units 11:30 pm Wednesday night and FedEx delivered them Friday morning! I was suitably impressed with the shipping! Both boxes and both TVs arrived in perfect condition.
