If you are purchasing this for a gift, keep in mind that anyone seeing the box would know immediately what it is, so if you want it to be a surprise take that into consideration. Setting up the TV was easy and the picture quality is excellent. They are almost as thin as an LED and they have swivel stands. They have matte finish screens so there is no reflected glare, and the frame is glossy black with a little thin red "racing stripe" around the edge (not really noticeable from the front view). Sound quality is pretty good for an LCD. As other reviewers have also mentioned, I turned off the energy saver mode because we like the picture brighter (it's the green button on the remote). I'm glad I bought these before the price went up. I researched the LG 42LK520 online to find the best price and Amazon could not be beat! Buying locally would have cost $100 more for the TV AND 7% on top of that for sales tax!

Reviews.Title: Everything I could ask for
Reviews.Author: gary
Reviews.Content: Ok so first off I'm not a huge tech geek what so ever... i just figured it was time to get rid of the 19 inch box in my room.... size is perfect, i would have been disappointed with a 32" like i was thinking about getting.... picture is great absolutely no complaints, i just turned the sound up to 65% today and it was louder than ill ever need it to be, plus i keep it around 15 and 20 and it is crystal clear.... i use my lap top on it most of all and stream shows and movies from that and it is perfect and flawless, im actually using it right now to write this review.... i have my xbox 360 hooked up with high definition cables andit is just unreal....everything just looks amazing..... its a nice looking tv with a rotating stand, three hdmi hook ups which is great cause i can have my phone and my lap top hooked up..... i Really couldnt have asked for anything better especially at this price... i am very pleased

Reviews.Title: Great HD Picture
Reviews.Author: KYLE
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV now for 4 months and have had absolutely no issues with it.  In fact, I have nothing but great things to say about it.  It impresses everytime friends come over to watch the games and with its sleek lines and modern look, it immediately becomes the focal point of any room.  Non-HD TV looks as one would expect, but 1080p Blu-Rays shine on this TV more than one would expect for such a "cheap" TV.  My connected PS3 makes MW3 look incredible.  I attached simple 2.1 PC speakers to the headphone jack and now have a budget home theater system.I agree with other reviews- you have to turn off all the "green" settings, turn the picture to "vivid", and have TruMotion set to "high".  With those settings, my TV makes Charlie from Always Sunny in Philly Season 6 (Blu-Ray) look like he's hanging out in my room, which let's face it, is awesome.Sure this TV doesn't have internet options, 3D, or new TV apps, but one shouldn't expect that for this price range.  Frankly, one shouldn't even expect this high quality picture from this price range.  That's why this TV is a clear 5 star winner.Above and beyond expectations of a budget TV.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Christopher A. Fleming "Chris F"
Reviews.Content: We purchased ours from Best Buy on 11-9-11. The TV has an amazing picture, the sound is very good for a flat panel, and best of all the price won't break the bank. The TruMotion is kind of annoying, but that is the case with all of the 120hz+ TVs, just turn it off. The only problem I have with the set is the "Dynamic Contrast" setting. When turned on, it causes the TV to dim on darker scenes, but I've only seen it happen on BluRay. Again, just turn that setting off, and everything is fine.The picture is the best I seen at the store, which was the main reason for the purchase. The "Picture Wizard" is great for adjusting the picture, makes it a whole lot easier. All in all, if you are looking for an excellent TV that doesn't cost a small fortune, you can't go wrong with this one.

Reviews.Title: Love This TV
Reviews.Author: agafiend
Reviews.Content: I spent months looking at TV's from every vendor and finally decided on this one. I did not need an additional WiFi device since I have a Tivo and a Roku and they do every thing I need in terms of network interface. And at 24 month no-interest financing it became a no-brainer!Out of the box it set up easily. The stand is a bit wobbly but since I don't plan to touch it other than to clean it occasionally that was a non-issue and the fact that it rotates on the stand makes it easy to adjust for visibility. I had to adjust the color and brightness settings a bit for my personal preferences but you may not have to. I did turn off the Energy Save feature and the Tru-Motion, the latter because the Tru-Motion made me feel ill even on Low. If you are prone to motion sickness as I am you may want to turn it off as well.I have been delighted with the performance so far. Even my old video tapes look gorgeous on it. It's so clear that I can even tell that my local newscasters wear WAY too much makeup (they look like plastic!), an unexpected side effect of the clarity.It is a beautiful set at a reasonable price and I can't recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: TV is awesome
Reviews.Author: Steve Ludwig
Reviews.Content: At first I was going to get an LG Smart Internet LED TV, but I decided to go with this basic model.  I am glad I went with this model because I was reading that LG is looking to place advertisements on their Smart TV interfaces.  Who really wants to deal with downloading and managing "apps" on an additional device!This 42LK520 is meeting my expectations in terms of picture quality and value.  Amazon also did an excellent job shipping this out to me via overnight!

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: SPYER231
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV, I did months of research and I always looked back on this one. I though it would be perfect! So we got it from best buy with an extended four year warranty. It was $549 for the TV, including tax and accessories and the price of the warranty was like $800 for everything. It was an amazing deal. It wasn't the easiest to install, the screws were kind of hard to screw in and after everything was up, the tv wobbles real easy on the stand. I heard a lot of other reviews on amazon saying that the stand wasn't the best made, I sort of agree with that. It works though. Every time we walk by it, it shakes. Overall a great TV. One more negative is that if you go onto a white screen, and you follow your finger across the screen from a few feet away, and look into the white screen at the same time, you can see black dots in pairs of two all across the screen. I think that's normal because I see it on a couple other LG HDTVs as well. Overall, good decent TV, its perfect for me, it has a swivel, which is nice, and a USB port, which is what I love! I use my 500GB external HDD on it all the time as well as my 8GB flash drive too. Speakers are underneath the TV, which isent the best, considering my old 32" Sony WEGA had TV speakers on the sides of it, they were awesome for TV speakers. My Aunt's 4 year old 37 inch Samsung has speakers on the sides too, they sound epic! The sound from these are nothing like that though. My Uncle has a Sharp Aquos 60 inch LED TV and it sounds like the speakers are cardboard box speakers, its terrible. At least my LG TV speakers are actually pretty decent when bass and treble controls are turned all the way up. I select different sound and video modes when I use the TV for different things, movies, games, music, DTV, ect... We do not and probably will not ever get cable of any kind. DTV is good enough for us. Plus, we have netflix for ps3 and the wii as well, which helps a lot. I'm glad I did not get an internet connectable TV, because internet connectable TVs most of the time have bad reviews. I mostly go by the reviews, and this TV has great reviews. So I went for it and I love it! I hate the fact that it has to be cleaned and dusted even though I love doing that, but I'm afraid it's always going to scratch it every time. Menu is a little slow at switching from one windows to the next, but not too bad. Great boot-up time, like 5 seconds! Don't you hate that when you can never seem to get your TV stand perfectly straight on your entertainment center/TV credenza? We have a 10' x 12' foot living room, so its kind of a small room, yes. We were looking into the same TV model, just a 47 inch instead, but the price range was over $250 more. I was originally thinking of a Dynex or Insignia, but I heard they have terrible sound and terrible contrast ratio (like 1000:1) that's terrible. Then I was thinking about a Samsung or RCA. Then I saw this, and I feel in love with it for months. I love this TV! Its perfect!

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Great Price!
Reviews.Author: Earls
Reviews.Content: I purchased a similar TV, a Vizio 42 inch 120 HZ with 1080p about 10 days before the arrival of my LG from Amazon.  The Vizio took a long time to start up, had an array of audio problems and was a bit more confusing when switching inputs.  While the LG and Vizio had similarly good pictures, my LG is far better on many other fronts.  The TV starts up very quickly, the input interface is really nice, all the inputs are grayed out and then when you plug a cord in it becomes colored so when you hit input you can see exactly which inputs are plugged into a source: the cable box, DVD, player, X-Box etc.  I like the volume settings, it turns up / down noticeable but not too much or too little with each number and is really a pleasure to use and watch.  I highly recommend this TV, which I got for around 575.00, for folks who want to make a big upgrade from their old 75 lb behemoth tube TV's (mine was a bear to lug to the basement).  It is a wonderful TV for a great price and as I don't do anything too fancy with my viewing / audio outputs, it was a perfect giant step up from my old Toshiba, which refuses to die by the way after many years of use.  Don't hesitate to buy this sucker, sports look good, movies look good, and my X-Box with the HDMI cable is a hoot!

Reviews.Title: This TV is SIC!!!!
Reviews.Author: B. Hines "Big Chris"
Reviews.Content: Pros: Incredible HD Picture  Very little picture adjustments needed, ready to go out the box  Looks sweet  Ease of hook up  Easily communicate with LG surround sound systemCons: Energy saving mode way too aggressive in dark rooms (Too Dark) (will update soon)I just hooked my new TV Lg 55 55LK520 and the LG LHB336 system, and WOW the sound and picture quality from Avatar was simply unbelievable, amazing. I have HD tv's in the house already (Toshibas) and have been very satified, but this thing takes the cake!  My brother help me hook it all up and was simply "floored" from the big sound that came out of this little system. The Tv looked "too" real, the quality and motion seems close to 240hz. I havent made any adjustments to the color yet, cause it looks perfect out the box (except for the Energy saving setting it gets way too dark in a dark room). I havent used any of the online stuff yet,  I have a lot of different things to play with on my new toys and will do an update soon.  But for now I'm in love!Updated:Still loving the set up, even though the unit has lost some of its connectivity. When I first installed, I could turn on the Blu Ray and it would automatically go to the blu ray, but now I have go to the blu ray input manually, even though the SimpleLink is turned to on, weird. Decided not to mess with the online stuff, I have several computers, Ps3, Wii, and everything's online, Its good to disconnect every now and again.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic unit
Reviews.Author: Bradley J Joiner
Reviews.Content: This was our third attempt to buy a TV for our bedroom. We bought one from another online retailer, one locally, and returned both. The third time was the charm.This unit is outstanding.  It is our first LG.  The second TV we bought was the 60Hz version of this one, and we could definitely tell a difference.  The video, particularly (obviously) during action sequences, was much better.  But (I believe) I could tell a difference even on scenes with little or no action.The sound was on the good side of average.  After seeing and hearing TVs with ridiculous sound level differences, it is very satisfactory.The inputs are good, and this one includes a composite video input for older video games if thats your thing.  I have seen several units lately that don't include that.Setup is great.  Easy, intuitive.  You can tweak as little or as much as you desire.  I have tried the wizard, but didn't particularly like the results so ended up back on a preset.As a Prime member, the overnight shipping for $4 was stunning.  I was a bit concerned about the box being sturdy enough for UPS shipping, but it arrived in one piece.For $600, I defy anyone to come up with a better unit.***********UPDATE*************I noticed the price dropped by roughly $20 on this unit.  I called Amazon and they credited me the difference.  Once again, Amazon rules.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT TV
Reviews.Author: DIAZFAR
Reviews.Content: recommend this tv to the person you are looking for quality and economy, with good picture settings and a blu ray player will be impressed with the image ... I'ma fan of video games and this tv give me the quality I was expecting.

Reviews.Title: wonderful while it worked
Reviews.Author: Grandma5
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the TV for a month.  On monday we went to turn the tv on and nothing happened.  After trying everything in the trouble shooting dept we contacted LG.  They had us repeat all of the trouble shooting steps again but no go.  They then told us that they did not have a repair man here and we would have to wait to hear from them when they could find one.  Of course we never did hear any thing.  After being without the tv for most of the week I talked to walmart whom we had bought it from and they agreed to take it back.  Walmart was very good about the return but we did have to haul it in without any help and wait around for someone to come check and make sure all the pieces were there.  The whole experience was not good.  I do appreciate walmart for being so good about taking it back.  I am disgusted with LG, dont think I want another one of their products.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Deadwood
Reviews.Content: I bought this for 3 reasons:1. Cost2. No interest in 3D (3d hurts my eyes after just a few minutes)3. Size (55 inch)Caution: Use the built in tuning wizard immediately.When I first turned the TV I thought it was "OK" but not great.  I tried all of the audio adjustments and I began to wonder if I had made a big mistake.  Then I used the wizard to fine tune my settings.  This created a custom settings and the image quality was great.  I love the picture now.Everything else works well but for me, I really only care about the quality of the HD picture.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV
Reviews.Author: Kristen Eversole
Reviews.Content: Easy to use.  Great picture quality.  Very happy with this purchase.  I had some concern about viewing angle after reading about LCD TVs since our family room is set up with viewing from both sides.  The viewing quality from the sides is better than I expected.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased!
Reviews.Author: Zach
Reviews.Content: I recently bought the 55 inch version of this tv from Best Buy. Although I prefer shopping on Amazon, the sell was too good to pass up ($950, which, according to by sources in best buy is store cost). If you are considering this tv, there are three things you should consider.1. This tv is very highly rated on consumer reports, and if you are interested in this tv, I think it would be very helpful to pay a month subscription to read it. It is about #3 on their list of 50-55 inch tvs, above Samsung and Sony.2. I searched all over the web for recommended calibration settings, but to no avail. I finally got my hands on the disney hd calibration blu-ray, and must say it is much much much more effective than the built in calibration software. This disc is worth every cent! The settings that it calibrated mine are:Brightness: 57Contrast: 98 (This sounds a little high, but the tv never looked better, and the test images are spot on)Color: 55Tint: 0Backlight: 50Horizontal and vertical sharpness: 503. Although this tv is not an LED, it goes come with LG's flagship level of display settings, in short, this tv can be calibrated to look it's very best. A lot of the LED tv's in this price range do not offer the full calibration settings. (including LG tvs)I would note, that I am using my ps3 as my blu-ray player, and the display setting are pretty extensive on the system, I would imagine that these settings my tv calibrated to most likely would be pretty far off if used by any other blu-ray player.Overall I am very pleased with my purchase. For the price, I think it is as good as you can expect. This tv performs just as well as a Sony or a Samsung (subject to opinion of course). I love watching this tv, and the picture quality, especially on blu-ray, is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: A PERFECT YET BASIC HDTV FOR THOSE THAT WANT IT SIMPLE
Reviews.Author: Lanya
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research on all HDTVs before buying this model. I've had mine for 6 months and no problems. It's great especially for those that want to upgrade from the old tube tv to this LG 42LK520. It does have a lot of nice features but is also very simple and will last a long time.I found out that the new LED models are just LCD HDTVs with an LED back light that might burn out faster than a regular LCD HDTV so that's one of the reasons why I chose this model.The 1080pixel with the 120hz motion is the best way to go because you will get a very clear picture without any tracers that you might get with a 720p/60hz or 1080p/60hz so I highly recommend this LG HDTV with the 1080p/120hz. LG is one of the best HDTV makers on the market. (Don't buy a Vizio, Phillips or Magnavox,(Phillips owns Magnavox now) they're all crap)!I actually bought the LG 42LK520 from walmart.com and picked it up at the store the same day for $598.00 on sale.From all the reviews I read it seems that people got confused with how the energy saver mode works, it's very easy to either turn it down to the lowest setting so it doesn't get too dark or you can turn it off completely for standard brightness, there's a green energy mode button on the remote that allows you to quickly adjust it.All in all this model is best for people that don't want to mess with a smart wifi internet connected HDTV but you can use this the 42LK520 as a PC monitor and connect a usb device so that's cool. It has 3 HDMI ports, coaxial cable port, usb port, pc vga port, audio ports, manual control buttons on the right side of the unit and good size remote with simplink.

Reviews.Title: Red Stripe
Reviews.Author: Ashley Armsbury
Reviews.Content: This is a great tv, but, it comes with an ugly red decorative stripe around the entire tv! This is not shown at all in the images.  Just wanted to let any future buyers know, incase they do not want a red stripe on their tv :)

Reviews.Title: HDMI Connection Does Not Work Now
Reviews.Author: B. Jones
Reviews.Content: I really liked this TV until I started having signal issues on my #2 HDMI connection a few months after I purchased the TV.  At first I thought it was the DVD player and actually purchased a new player.  The problem kept happening so to rule out the TV connection itself I switch to the #1 HDMI connection I have not have one lost signal again from the DVD player.  The problem now is I only have two HDMI connections on this TV, not to mention that the return period is only 30 days with Amazon and how I was supposed to figure out one of the HDMI connections was failing is beyond me in only 30 days.

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: Satm
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a good quality, basic tv, this is it. I mainly use this tv for what it is -- a tv. It is very nice as a basic tv and comes with enough HDMI ports to support a few simple little add-ons like google tv, roku, DVD players, etc. We've also hooked up a computer and some speakers. We've had this for around 9 months now and are so pleased with it that we bought the newer model (42cs570) a few months ago for another bedroom.

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: David Green "greymanethewise"
Reviews.Content: came earlier tha expected, easy to set up, works flawlessly and when I did call the company with a question, they were quick to answer.  But the proof of this television will be how it last into the future.  So far, it's been great.

Reviews.Title: LG 55LK520
Reviews.Author: paul
Reviews.Content: Disappointed with the performance..flashlighting around edges and motion blurring is annoying. The screen has alot of glare when not in a dark room. I would have paid more for a better TV had I known the drawbacks of this model.

Reviews.Title: This is a great television!
Reviews.Author: Bizzlebob
Reviews.Content: I have had this television for about a week now.  I love it!  This is my 3rd LCD HD Television I have owned.  The first two were a 19" 780p and a 32" 780p.  I decided it was time to spend a little more, but not go crazy, and purchase a larger better, HD television.  I researched TV's online, and looking through Consumer Reports,  LG seemed to place well in all areas.  The LG 42LK520 was a perfect fit for size, price and quality.  The picture is amazing!  I can't get over watching my normal HD tv shows and seeing what a huge difference the jump from 780p to 1080p makes.  Picture is crisp, clear, and colors are vibrant.  It sometimes feels 3D to watch.  I adjusted the pictures using the picture wizard after initial setup.  You are shown a painting, and then go can go through different categories to change it how you like.  The remote is very easy to use.  There are plenty of connection options.  I have a Sony Blu-Ray player, and I am blown away, again, at how great it is to watch a blu-ray movie on this TV.  I find the sound to be just fine.  I'm not an audiophile, and I can hear everything fine for TV at the 16-20 range.  Watching streamed Netflix, I usually need it higher, around 25.  But max range is like 60, so I think the sound is just fine.  The options for changing different themes for sound is nice too.Anyway, for a normal, everyday user, who likes technology, but can't afford trying out everything, I think this TV is just great.

Reviews.Title: This TV is Perfect
Reviews.Author: Seanboy
Reviews.Content: So, I purchased this TV after completing my 10x16 "Family Room"; I was looking for a TV that was 1080 HD, 120 hz, and had USB input. I shopped around and looked at many TV's in the 42-46" range, finally deciding that 42" would be the best fit in my smaller sized room. I promptly added the cable box and BAM! I was watching the NCAA tourney in HD. But, if you read this review, please buy: Mediabridge Ultra Series - High Speed HDMI Cable with Ethernet - (6 Feet) - Category 2 Certified - Supports 3D & Audio Return Channel [Latest HDMI Version Available] cable. I had the stadard HDMI cable that came with the cable box, and the quality lacked. I purchased the Mediabridge cable, and the TV came alive. I now love the picture which is amazing for a TV less that $600. The custom color screener lets you set it up exactly how you want it.My room is basically a sunroom, with 5 36x60 windows, and a large double glass door, so there is a lot of light. I put the TV in the corner at a 45 degree angle, and turned OFF the intelligent sensor, and have ZERO issues seeing the screen. The sound is a little weak, but that wasn't my concern. A nice 8-10" powered subwoofer will probably bring this TV alive.Overall, picture quality is simply amazing, colors are brilliant, HD movies are incredible. It has two HDMI inputs, I use one for cable and the other for Xbox. The USB port works nicely, and I have not used the component ports yet, as they are becoming obsolete.I give this TV a 9/10; one point docked for sound, but again, that wasn't my primary concern in a small room. I love this 42" TV, you will be hard pressed to find better quality for a cheaper price.Shipping was quick, and arrived in perfect condition. Setup is quick and easy, the TV seems very light compared to our 48" flat screen.

Reviews.Title: LG 47" TV  PURCHASED AT AMAZON
Reviews.Author: Bob Johns
Reviews.Content: WE ARE ENJOYING THIS TV.  IT HAS LIVED UP TO THE AD ABOUT THE TV.THE PICTURE IS VERY CLEAR.  IT IS IMPORTANT TO ADJUST TO YOUR ROOM LIGHTING AND THIS MAY TAKE SEVERAL TRIES TO ADJUST TO YOUR SPECIFIC TASTE.A LITTLE SHAKEY ON A TABLE AND IF YOU HAVE SMALL CHILDREN YOU MUST STABLIZE THE SCREEN AS RECOMMENDED IN THE DIRECTIONS.

Reviews.Title: Phenomenal
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: The picture on this tv is phenomenal. In HD the characters look as though they are coming out of the screen.This was definitly a good buy

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV
Reviews.Author: ceeasley21
Reviews.Content: Have had this TV for about a month now and I am extremely pleased with it! Picture quality is great and when setting it up you can tweak it to your preference. The menu gives you a lot of power to fine tune things the way you want it, but is still easy to use. The thing that really surprised me was the sound quality. For a flat screen, the sound is excellent and it gets louder than I expected.

Reviews.Title: You may need a digital audio converter!
Reviews.Author: Yessong "alankk"
Reviews.Content: Unit shipped the same day it was ordered and was ready for delivery eight days later.  The "white glove" service is great -- they assemble the stand (yes, it's a bit flimsy) and stay until the unit is connected and shows a picture. Set-up was extremely easy.Picture is good, but not mind-blowing. Still, seems terrific bang for the buck. Wizards make adjusting a breeze. Like many others, I find that the power save and tru-motion features are best turned off. Customizable zoom is a very likeable feature!Audio is just okay, but I'm intent on routing through my stereo receiver and speakers. Note that this unit has only digital audio output, meaning you'll need a converter and toslink cable if your receiver doesn't have that input (like mine).  The two products were $25 on Amazon.An absence of frills, a cheap stand, and a picture that is good, not crazy-good, but the picture wizards and custom zoom earn the fifth star. A week later, I'm very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: LG HDTV
Reviews.Author: johnphotographer
Reviews.Content: A very good HDTV.The 1st one we received was damaged... (that was a bummer)but it was replaced a week later.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: othniel
Reviews.Content: This LG works very well. The picture is clear, the sound is perfectly fine for a medium sized living room at appropriate viewing distance for a 42in screen. The sound range is not amazing, but of course it should not be expected to be.  The quality is perfect.  The remote is easy to use and the settings are easy to adjust. Very nice TV. Shipped in its' own box and UPS delivery man said "hope it works, these get thrown around a lot when they ship them by UPS" which had be very worried, but it has worked like a charm.  We have it hanging on the wall with a tilt mount.

Reviews.Title: Basic Review of LG 47LK520
Reviews.Author: Flomar86
Reviews.Content: This is the first TV I have bought online, and the first 1080p TV I've bought.  First note, when you buy this TV you are not buying any special features.  Besides trumotion (which should be turned off if you are watching any HD) and clear voice (I cannot find any reason to use it) there are really no special features such as online TV.Packaging: Absolutely perfect, arrived with no defects and was properly packaged.Set up: Very quick, screw driver needed. The stand is not perfect, but not terrible.Audio: I read reviews saying the audio was not the best, but I have not yet found any reason to complain.  I plan on getting surround sound anyway.Picture: I'm not fully decided.  I really like the quality, and if you do research online the specs are pretty average.  My only complaint is that at times I don't feel like the blacks and clarity is as good as my old 720p Plasma TV. Although I can't argue that there are a lot of positives compared to my old TV, I had expected it to be superior in every way.TV Frame:  Not too thin.  If you're looking for a very thin TV, there are better choices out there.Overall:  Very happy with my purchase.  4 stars because I wish the TV was thinner.  Will probably have this TV for the next 5-10years of my life, until it's the right time to upgrade to the very new OLEDs that are coming out, or what ever new technology they think of

Reviews.Title: Seems to be what was advertised
Reviews.Author: Michael Cody
Reviews.Content: 42" - replacing a 42" plasma Panasonic (son's taking it back) .. used for Comcast Cable, Netflix streaming - etc.. Pic is good, came packed well, setup was easy. I stream internet video via BDP210 BlueRay play and output sound via Yamaha system. No problems with pixels or other concerns. Much lighter than the plasma. Sound is satisfactory for regular TV viewing. Overall so far - so good. 80$ cheaper than Walmart w/free shipping and at this price - I will just self insure, don't see it's worth having anything outside the of the normal warranty.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the price
Reviews.Author: troy ficquette
Reviews.Content: Basic LCD TV and can't beat it for the price.  Great picture and decent speaker sound.  Be sure to setup the image when you first get the TV to get the most out of it.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: BK
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the cost.  Currently watching some bowl games on it and the color and crispness of the picture is excellent.Disappointed that it sat in Amazon's warehouse for 4 days before finally shipping, at my strong request.All in all, very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Satisfaction
Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: The TV arrived on schedule and on the date I requested. Itwas set up and tested in the room I designsted. I have now useed this TV regularly as my primary set. It has a great picture and excellent color performance. I'm very happy with this LG TV and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Babsy13
Reviews.Content: I needed to purchase a new television and researched for hours what would be the best television to buy and still stay within my budget.  I finally decided on this LG 42 inch and I'm so glad I did because this television is awesome.  The set-up was a breeze, the picture is clear and amazing and sound quality is perfect.  I highly and enthusiastically recommend this to anyone looking to purchase a fabulous television at a great prize.LG 42LK520 42-Inch 1080p 120 Hz LCD HDTV

Reviews.Title: Good TV but some backlight bleed
Reviews.Author: GJT
Reviews.Content: Great TV but I am seeing some backlight bleed in the lower right corner during dark scenes and when there's no signal.  I'm going to exchange it for another, maybe it's just a fluke.  Besides that, I'm pretty happy with the set.

Reviews.Title: Great tv and a great price!
Reviews.Author: Tommy Boy "Tom"
Reviews.Content: I bought this model after looking over a number of options. I was impressed by the number of good reviews I saw here and elsewhere. The setup was a snap and went by quickly. I just have broadcast at home and was amazed at the high quality picture I received.  I had put off getting a new tv because there was nothing wrong with my analog tv with the converter box, but I wanted a new toy and loved the picture I saw on friends' new models so I broke down and finally got one.I've played around with the different video modes on the tv and they all offer an excellent picture. As with some other reviewers, I turned off the power saving feature since the picture seemed too dark while watching a football game in the sports mode.The only negative I have is that is does not have RCA audio outlets, only one digital optical audio output. This was a problem because I wanted to hook it up to my stereo receiver to get TV audio into my stereo system for sports, etc. My receiver is older and only has the red/white audio connections.  This is easily solved by getting a digital to analog audio converter for about $25.00, cable included.This audio issue is really a minor one if you don't mind buying the converter if you have an older reciever. It was a small price to pay rather than upgrading to a newer receiver when mine was fine.

Reviews.Title: LG and Amazon make beautiful TV together
Reviews.Author: Frankie
Reviews.Content: LG 42LK520 42-Inch 1080p 120 Hz LCD HDTVThe picture of this LG TV is very very nice.I love to shop Amazon forbig ticket items like this for a few reasons1 reviews from real people like you and me actually using the product2 price and selection! for me a fair price and no tax wins every timethrow in free shipping to my door.Why would I go to a store to lug it home and pay more3 you can really research and get the right model for you instead of the model or brand beinghyped at the big storeThe TV is NICE!! perfect set for my bedroom at 42inch with the picture wizard makesyour picture custom in moments. Want a Smart TV buy the roku and plug it in.Your TV will be smart and so will you knowing you saved hundreds of $$$Originally thought ID go LED but with this set you would be hard pressed to finda nicer picture especially at this price

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV for the price (but turn off Tru-Motion)
Reviews.Author: TexasTwoTone
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for about five months, and have been very satisfied thus far. Picture quality is very good bordering on excellent. This TV is a "cold cathode ray", which is an older style of backlighting. Dynamic contrast (and deep blacks) thus aren't quite as vibrant compared to newer lighting types.Only downside so far: You'll definitely want to disable the "Tru-Motion" feature that comes enabled by default--it makes everything look bizarrely cartoonish.Bottom line: this a great TV, and hits the price-to-performance ratio smack in the kisser.

Reviews.Title: Great TV....
Reviews.Author: jkodko
Reviews.Content: First off, great job to Amazon for the best price and fast shipping, tv was delivered 2 days before original delivery date and in perfect condition. Now the TV, i was looking for a basic LCD TV 1080p 120hz with a nice picture, wow!! did i find one. After doing side by side comparisons in the stores and a lot of online research i decided on the LG47LK520. Picture is awesome! with a little tweaking on the settings i have the perfect picture. The settings themselves are easy to use. Even my non HD channels look great. If your looking for a mid level LCD TV with no bells and whisltes you cannot go wrong with this LG model.

Reviews.Title: Money well spent
Reviews.Author: RC "R C"
Reviews.Content: Great tv for its price.. i prefer led.. but for this price this tv does an excellent job.. very good picture..

Reviews.Title: LG 42" LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Patrick Cullie
Reviews.Content: Pretty happy with this TV. excellent price, delivered to my door in tact. great quality picture. i'm not a complete technical moron, but TV setup can be a pain. love the HDMI cables and that there are only two cables in the entire rig. (note tho, you have to spend between $40-$80 on cables, above and beyond the TV itself.) all in all i would give this four stars. only complaint is that the stand seems a little cheap. it's fine, just would be nice to have a bit more substantial base. I recommend this product at this price point.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: VA Gamer
Reviews.Content: I don't use my living room television often, and needed something at least 42" for PS3 gaming, Bluray watching, and the occasional streaming. For the price this TV looked great in the store, so I picked it up.(+) First, the picture quality is fantastic, though you have to do some tweaking out of the box. This shouldn't be a surprise, especially for a cheap mid-range HDTV, but I could see it bothering people. Specifically, I had to adjust several presets (particularly back lighting) for games, movies, and TV. But once you get the image right I have no complaints. Coming from an older TV, the 120Hz makes a huge difference in fast paced games and Blurays. (I did try the light sensor for automatic adjustment, but my living room has some rather unique and changing natural lighting and it had some issues with that - when I tested it in another room it was fine, so I'm not faulting the score too much for that)(+/-) The audio isn't that great. It makes my old Toshiba sound like a live orchestra in comparison. It's hollow and frankly weak sounding with certain media, merely OK at other times. Any cheap sound bar will, of course, fix this problem(+) The inputs most people will need, but nothing extra: USB, 3 HDMI's, PC audio, digital audio (out), headphone, and RGB(+) It's light and thin with a swivel base. Slick, minimalist design. Takes up very little space for a 42" TV(-) No network connectivity (ethernet, Wifi). So to connect it to your network or use services like Hulu+ or Netflix you'll need either a LG accessory or something that already provides this functionality (Roku play, Bluray with Wifi, 360 or PS3, etc)(+) Can't beat that price for a 120Hz, 1080p HDTV from a good manufacturer that is known for being customer friendly

Reviews.Title: Amazing Picture
Reviews.Author: TINA TERRELL
Reviews.Content: We weren't quite sure if we would like it, but we knew we liked LG products.  This TV is off the chain, everything looks like it is in real time, even a movie, looks like it is real time.  I love that you can put in a flash drive and just queue up a movie, no more DVD!

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture, excellent value.
Reviews.Author: Bob L "Bob L"
Reviews.Content: The only 2 downside is I would have liked a 4th HDMI input and the remote.  The remote is not programmable to work with a cable box so I need the cable remote.  The cable remote can be programmed to work the TV but then I don't have the options of sleep, changing picture settings etc.  I wouldn't detract any stars for the HDMI as I knew this before purchasing.  I almost did for the remote but the picture quality and ability to calibrate this are astounding.  The auto calibration feature does good to get you going quickly out of the box but there are forums dedicated to this and similar models.  The calibration features of this TV rival that of many higher priced and higher end boxes.  I don't know if everyone who orders from Amazon will be lucky enough to get the IPS panel, but I was and this is a very good panel at this price point.  you can tell by the id number for your TV).  If you'd like to see satisfied owners and find settings, you can find them here on AVSForum.Update 1/1/2012 - I've dropped this to 4 stars for now, could go lower.  Just days over 2 months, the TV is in need of service.  Very disappointed.  The good news is that my total call time from dial, to hold to pickup to hang up was 25 minutes.  I have a dispatch for 1/3 in the AM.  Hopefully I don't have to wait for parts to come in as well.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV
Reviews.Author: Kyle
Reviews.Content: A 3 years ago I bought the 42" version of this model for my bedroom and have been very happy with it.  Recently I needed a new living room tv and decided to purchse the larger version of this model.  I purchased the 55" and have been very happy with it.  This is the same model number as my smaller one but it has been updated a bit.  Would recommend this for anyone who does not buy into the hype of the LED tv's and just wants a reliable and stylish LCD tv.

Reviews.Title: Solid TV
Reviews.Author: Keith
Reviews.Content: This TV, after nearly a month, seems very good.  Picture looks great.  Sound is pretty good for a flat screen.  Very happy with.  I only felt comfortable ordering a TV this large thru Amazon due to their low price gaurantee and there excellent return policy in case you don't like it.  So far after a month, I have not seen it cheaper anywhere.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Affordable TV
Reviews.Author: BBuzz
Reviews.Content: I work in television for a national cable network and I can say that this TV is incredible.  One thing you have to note is that Trumotion probably has to be turned OFF.  I was watching Arrested Development on Netflix on an XBOX 360, and the Trumotion was totally weird.  It made things look TOO crisp and unblurred.  But you can kill it in the options, and all is well.  That said, I upgraded from a 32 inch Samsung, and this TV blows it out of the water, especially for the price.  The picture is SO crisp and honestly, I don't understand any beefs about the sound.  I am a professional sound designer and national TV mixer and the audio from this TV is perfectly fine.  Of course, if you want better sound, then hook up a decent sound system.  But for me, its totally great.  At any rate, I've had this TV for all of one day, but I am exceedingly thrilled with the picture quality and sound....especially for the cheap price.  Great set.

Reviews.Title: Again, LG Doesn't Disappoint
Reviews.Author: Joan Valor "page turner"
Reviews.Content: purchased the 47LK520 to replace another 47" which was fried by a power spike. I don't want silly Internet apps (better off with a laptop for more reliable operation). I just want a reliable television with a great picture and good sound (when not using my 7.1 surround sound). Again, an LG product exactly fills my need with great quality at a great price. I have other LG products for other needs and have been very satisfied with the performance of each.This TV has incredible clarity and color. The sound was surprisingly good and fills the room without excessive volume. I was able to quickly connect and verify all my devices and found the menu easy to use. I have seen some complaints about the stand being "cheap" but don't have the same observation. The usual wall-mounts of flat-screens ameliorate any issue.If you want a great television at a great price, this is the set for you.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, great price
Reviews.Author: T. Hall
Reviews.Content: TV was just as advertised.  Great, picture and at a great price.  I looked around at all the differrent tvs (plasma, lcd, led) and it seemed to me that for the price at this size, this is your best option.  3D doesn't interest me either, that is why this tv is perfect.  Yea, I could have paid 50% more and gotten a LED, but I really don't think they are worth the money.  When it comes to technology, I usually buy what was the big thing a year or two ago...otherwise you get suckered into spending far more than you need to for practically the same thing.  If you aren't sure..this tv won't dissapoint!

Reviews.Title: Really nice TV at a great price
Reviews.Author: Cmiddl01
Reviews.Content: This is my first LCD TV and I did a LOT of research. Out all all of the TVs I looked at, this is the only one with almost 100% positive reviews on all websites.  Now I know why! I don't have HD cable service or a fancy Blu Ray, but the picture quality on this TV is amazing.  The smart motion technology is a fantastic feature.  Once I fiddled with the sound options some, it provides a great sound quality.  This has some pretty fantastic energy smart features, however, I found the smart techonolgy with it made the screen a little too dark for me with no lights on.  So, I adjusted it to the medium energy saving mode and now I love it!  This TV was at a great price and Amazon beat every competitor by at least $70.  Only negative I have is that I received free 3-5 day shipping but it took 10 days to get here.  If I had paid for shipping, I would have complained to Amazon.  Since I didn't pay, I didn't complain.Overall, this is a great purchase and I would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Picture
Reviews.Author: Mark D. Rosenthal
Reviews.Content: I made this purchase based on the many reviews at Amazon.  The size fit my space perfectly, and the many good reviews made up my decision to purchase it.  I  am using this with a HTPC that I have build with a Zotac Mini-mag, and use the HDMI inputs from the PC, as well as component inputs from my Home Theatre, which is fed by my Satellite DVR.I do not yet have satellite HD, but nevertheless, the picture is amazing.  I won't use Bluetooth due to the nightmare that is DRM, but the DVD picture quality is great! Just yesterday, I was viewing a slide show of my photos through XBMC on the connected PC, and couldn't believe the quality and clarity of the photos.  Viewing YouTube in HD is amazing as well, as is streaming HD content from the Internet.The menu system is very easy to use, and over-scan was easily corrected to get the HTPC display to look perfect.  I am extremely happy with this purchase, the price couldn't be beat, and Amazon is so easy to deal with!

Reviews.Title: Best Full HD TV for the Price
Reviews.Author: Put the 610 up there
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a new HDTV and originally wanted to get one of the LED backlit ones, but decided to save some cash and go for just a standard LCD. Couldn't be happier with my purchase. You can't beat the price, free shipping, and the picture quality is top notch when you get the settings properly configured. Doesn't have all the fancy widgets, apps, and internet connectivity like the higher model, but I didn't really plan on using them too much anyway. I got a cable to hook my Mac up to the screen so I can use it for those types of things that way if I need to. I like how you can plug in a USB external harddrive to view pictures and watch movies/tv shows you have downloaded that way. Overall, very happy with the TV and no complaints so far!

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Tom R.
Reviews.Content: After doing tons of research into different tvs in my budget, I finally settled on the LG LK520. Its a steal for being 120Hz and 1080p. In my mind, if you are going to drop some dough on a tv you might as well buy one with the best specs available. The picture is great and makes me wish I had more HD channels. My xbox 360 looks great on it. The menu is intuitive and the picture set up when you first start is super easy and specific. The stand is a little tipsy but as long as you aren't chest bumping it, you'll be fine. I would recommend this product to anyone.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: dave
Reviews.Content: I have had this tv for 6 days and I love it!  The picture looks awesome on hd programming and I just cant get over the fact that it will read almost any video format on the usb portI have some movies as a file on my ipod and it will recognize and play those file whether they are AVI or MPEG4 and the quality is amazing...The sound quality as many other reviews have stated is not the loudest but for a silent movie night the volume on the unit is just fine if you have company over that are talking while you are trying to watch a movie then yes you may need to buy some additional speakers but other than that it handles fine.The True motion feature I have to admit I am not a fan of.  However, it is a feature that can be tweeked or completely turned off based on you choice.Also, make sure to mess around with the picture setting to get that look that you are looking for, everyone is different and have different preferences so do not give it a negative review without messing around with the settings first.  Lastly, the stand is a bit unstable however this is also going to depend if you properly tighten the screws on the base and the furniture piece you have you tv sitting on.So in conclusion, I love my new tv and I love the fact that this is the lowest i could find it anywhere for $50 and i looked around for about a month.

Reviews.Title: awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: I am a samsung person but this TV is great so far.  It was easy to set up so my friend who set it up for me.  Awesome pictures great sound.  He could not believe the clarity of the picture.  Games look awesome the price was outstanding.Glad I choose this one.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: 12Junes
Reviews.Content: I've only had the TV about 2 weeks, so far, so good. I love the picture quality and the ease of adding devices. I'm not keen on the menus, but they're not insurmountable.

Reviews.Title: Very nice TV.
Reviews.Author: SFC
Reviews.Content: This is an upgrade to an old CRT TV, so my opinion might be a bit skewed in comparison to other LCDs.  Regardless, the colors are brilliant on the television and the 120hz is great for watching sports, thought you might want to turn it off for movies and most other programs.  It has plenty of HDMI ports to connect to if you have a lot of video sources.  It also includes component and composite sources for older devices.  The built in speakers, while not great, are adequate for most viewing.  It also has a USB port that can play video, audio and picture files, including mkv's directly from an external hard drive or thumb drive.  It doesn't play DTS audio however, so audio will have to be encoded into AAC or something like that.  Overall, it is a great television, worthy of being at the center of any home entertainment setup.

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: yum
Reviews.Content: i looked around several places before buying and at several brands and models. this was a great buy. it has a terrific picture and operates easily. have enjoyed very much so far.

Reviews.Title: LG 55 inch TV
Reviews.Author: elrich
Reviews.Content: I received my LG TV about a week ago.  Setup was easy and the picture is great.  The colors and picture quality of this TV is just as good as any LED that I have seen.  The audio is good for a 2 speaker system.  And my ordinary DVD works well with this model.  I thought the price was reasonable. But I checked out other suppliers and the price seemed to be standard at most suppliers.  I went with Amazon because of the free shipping and easy ordering.  The shipping company was fast delivery and great servers.  Very please with the overall experience.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV
Reviews.Author: j.k. "amazon shopper"
Reviews.Content: It's a great TV, great price, clear beautiful pictures. I got it from amazon direct at the time, very happy with their fast service. This was the second TV we ordered in two weeks. The colors and images seem to be even better than the LG LED 60HZ 37inch purchased one week before this one.

Reviews.Title: Quality LCD
Reviews.Author: MChief576
Reviews.Content: I currently own a 4 year old 40" Samsung LCD.  When I moved, I decided to upgrade my TV.  I originally bought a 51" Samsung Plasma.  I loved the picture, but I couldn't stand the reflection from the glass screen.  As I looked for another TV, I found out that most HDTV's, have a glass screen.  This really narrowed my search.  I eventually settled on this 55" LG LCD.  I got the free shipping from amazon.  The TV was at my house within a few business days.  The shipping service brought my TV upstairs and made sure it worked.  Luckily I had no bad pixels.  Since this has a matte screen, there was minimal reflection.  However, I wasn't completely satisfied the first 2 days.  I thought the picture quality was just OK.  Plus, there was light bleeding in the bottom right hand corner.  After adjusting the settings, and researching the AVS website, the picture is much better.  Also, the bleeding seems to have stopped.  I use HDMI for TV/Blu-Ray and component cables for my xbox360.  Watching blu-ray is very nice.  Xbox is good.  I'm sure the picture would be better with a HDMI connection.  The TV quality varies widely depending on the TV station.  Certain HD channels almost have blu-ray quality.  While other HD channels, barely look like HD.  I don't use the TV sound, since I have a HTIB.After getting a decent picture, I still wanted more.  So, I bought the Disney WOW disc.  I found the disc easy to use, with good navigation.  It goes through all the basic TV settings: brightness, contrast, color, tint, sharpness and scaling.  It also goes through audio settings, which I didn't use.  Since I already made some adjustments on my own, it wasn't that helpful.  I found it good for 2 reasons:  1) The disc comes with a blue filter, to help you adjust the color/tint.  2) It also helped me with scaling.  I had it set on 16:9.  After a few tests, I changed it to "Just Scan".  This provided more picture on the screen, and slightly more detail.  Unfortunately, this was not enough for me to keep the disc.  If you haven't done any tweaking to the TV, I would recommend it.My one complaint: I wish the 3rd HDMI slot was behind the TV, not on the side.If you are looking for a 55" HDTV without 3D, internet, etc, then I recommend this LG.

Reviews.Title: initial review
Reviews.Author: MaxNix
Reviews.Content: The only reason I didn't give it five stars is that it's only been three weeks and I hope it lasts for years.Picture is very good.I found that the energy-saving feature resulted in brightness too low for my taste and just set the brightness for 55% which was a very good level for our den.Fairly easy to adjust various settings with the reomote.No trouble getting the Verizon FIOS remote to work with the set, got the code online.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I wanted for an LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Bobby G
Reviews.Content: ** EDIT: Originally given 5 stars, I've adjusted this down to 4 stars due to a hardware problem I mention at the bottom of the review. **Let me start by saying this was my first purchase from LG.  I was in the market for a new HDTV, slightly bigger than my current 32", and while I was hesitant to go with a brand I didn't have any personal experience with, I went with this TV and I am so glad I took that leap of faith... LG came through.I've been a fan of Samsung screens for a while now.  My very first LCD computer monitor was a Samsung 17", then I helped my dad purchase a 55" LCD HDTV when they were kind of a new thing, and about a year and a half ago I purchased my aforementioned 32" 720p 60hz HDTV.  When looking to upgrade after moving, needing a bit more screen size after my average viewing distance increased from about 5-6 feet to 10-12 feet, I looked at Samsung first, but this LG caught my eye for its price, favorable reviews, and the bonus 2" screen size over the Samsung 40".  When Amazon brought the price down to $549, that was enough for me and I jumped on this set.  After using it for about a month, I would definitely have paid $600 for this TV and probably more; needless to say, I'm thrilled with it.That's enough back story, now into the product itself.PICTURE - Obviously the issue everyone cares most about is picture quality.  Well let me say this LG performs fantastically.  I watch DVDs and Blu Rays on it, I stream NetFlix on it, I game on it (Xbox 360 with component cables and PS3 with HDMI) and for all of them the TV is amazing.  As I've said, I mostly watch from a bit of a distance (about 10 feet) but sometimes I sit up closer, maybe 5 feet away, and the picture quality is still stunning and extremely, extremely smooth.It's hard for me to really notice the 1080p over the 720p because my comparison is so contrasted (32" vs 42"), but suffice to say my devices have never looked better while being hooked up to this guy.  I think I can notice the 120hz refresh rate.  My 60hz Samsung would "ghost" a bit when playing games, something one would get used to, so it wasn't much of an issue, but this TV does not ghost at all.  Picture is crisp and clear and the refresh rate is awesome.  The 42" upgrade over a 32" doesn't sound like much but believe me it is extremely noticeable and impressive. This is a big TV.SOUND - Satisfactory sound, nothing unexpected here (which is a good thing).  It has a headphones port on the side which is the feature that I really appreciate (but I think is commonplace with HDTVs these days). I haven't had to blast the sound up to max ever yet, even when I want things to be LOUD, and haven't experienced the speakers crackling out during any loud moments even when I've had it at it's highest, which was maybe 65% of the maximum allowed.  All in all for sound, completely satisfactory.MENU - I don't place much value on menus on a TV... every set has its own menus (it seems) and once one figures them out, they're as quick and efficient as they would be on another setup.  The only thing that could be a detriment to a set regarding menus is if the menus are convoluted and counter-intuitive, this set's menus are just fine.OTHER - This TV touts its "energy-saver" feature.  Essentially, what this does (I haven't used it much) is dim the screen after a certain amount of hours of use per day.  I believe it may also have an iPhone/iPad style sensor where it detects the amount of light in a room and adjusts the screen brightness accordingly... I guess it's a nice option to have, but maybe on my 3rd day of using the TV I turned the EnergySaver to "minimal" and have left it there.  Can't complain about having options though right?Also, one thing I like better about this system instead of my last Samsung are the actual buttons for power/input/channel/volume on the side of the set.  The Samsung I had used touch sensors, which were kind of cool but when it's dark, good luck getting the right "button" clicked.  This way, with real buttons, one can memorize the order of the buttons and can operate the TV (if needed, a remote is included obviously) in the dark from the set itself.  Something that comes up rarely but when it's an issue it can be annoying; no issues here.OVERALL - If you couldn't tell, overall I'm extremely pleased with this purchase. I love the extra 2" from the 40" Samsung, the price is great, and I couldn't ask for better picture quality.  I will definitely purchase from LG again in the future.Thanks for reading, hope I was helpful.**EDIT on 6/27/2012 below:**After owning and using the TV for about 8 months with I'd say "moderate" usage, the power supply died.  The TV would have instances when running on HD (which uses more power, presumably) where the screen would flicker on for a split second, and the TV would power off and power back on.  Over the course of a week this recurring issue persisted, with more and more resets before the TV would function as normal again, until it finally stopped turning on altogether.$180 in repairs later, it now works like a charm.  A little internet research during the downtime had me suspecting it was a power supply issue, which the repair guy ultimately confirmed.  $10 in parts $170 in labor for the repairs.  Presumably he just grabbed a new power supply and soldered it on, at least I hope he did... if he just plugged it in I'll feel ripped off (I didn't open the back to check, I will if it dies again).Based on my internet research this problem is somewhat common with this model of TV.  Except for this one issue I am extremely pleased with the TV, although having to drop another $180 on it wasn't too fun. If that is a one-time issue that the power supply fixes, I'll still be pleased with my purchase (although at a total price of around $700 it's not exactly 5 stars).If you experience a similar issue with your TV, know that it's likely a faulty power supply.  If you have an electrician friend I'd recommend investigating self-repair.  Again, I did not verify, but if this TV's power supply works like a PC power supply, it should be fairly simple to replace yourself, just a matter of buying the correct wattage or whatever which is more than likely listed on the old part.Best of luck.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price.
Reviews.Author: Vutar
Reviews.Content: Pro:Picture: You may have to mess with the setting to get it where you want but it is a great picture for the price. My PS3 games look great on this.Accessible: Everything is easily accessible for hook up. (may only be a pro for me but my last TV was a nightmare)Con:Sound. Do not underestimate how poor the internal speakers are. I did and am now waiting on external speakers to be delivered. I have it in a bedroom and it still was difficult to hear over a window unit air conditioner.Stand. As mentioned in other reviews it's cheap. The TV wobbles if you touch it.Overall:For the price it probably can't be beat. I'd have given it 5 stars but the sound is so bad I couldn't do it. My laptop has better internal sound.

Reviews.Title: First LG Purcahse.  Great Experience.
Reviews.Author: PJ
Reviews.Content: I am coming from the Samsung line and so far have been very pleased with this purchase.  A tough go at first with my first LG on the set up but once I was rolling all is well.  The home setting needs to be tweaked because at first set up/glance it will give you a very dark picture.  The only hitch I have and hopefully someone with LG experience can assist, is how do I get the Infinite Sound setting chosen? Mine is greyed out and I can not selected it so far.  The Clear Voice II is very crisp however. So far I would strongly recommend this and JR in NYC was very quick in sending my shipment.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Morris J. Rudometkin "The Cowboy"
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with this purchase. The TV is really great but I have ONE ISSUE, it was NOT packaged correctly and part of the stand was missing so I had to lean it up to my entertainment center until I received the missing part from LG. Only a 4 Star rating overall because of the hassle of getting the missing part.One person said the delivery people did not open the box but they did for me, plugged it in, turned it on "no picture because did NOT connect to cable" and said all parts were there "wrong".May 28, 2011 - Note: I did the same review on the LG Web site but they rejected it because it did NOT meet their standards!

Reviews.Title: FIRST LCD
Reviews.Author: Eatonjr
Reviews.Content: This is my first LCD purchase, but have been doing a lot of research when I finally decided to go with LG. I have only had this TV for a few days, and don't have my digital cable setup yet, so this review is only with my Blu-ray. I am really happy with this purchase. The clarity of the screen is great. I have the TruMotion on low right now (there are several settings, including "User" defined) and it was so crisp and clear. I saw a little of the "soap opera" effect that other reviews have talked about, but honestly I wouldn't know what that was if I hadn't seen in so much in other reviews, but it didn't bother me at all. I haven't done to much customization yet with the screen. I really like the Clear Voice technology. You can adjust the voices levels so they don't get lost in the background. It was nice not having to crank up the volume so I could hear the people talk and not have to get blown away when the volume on the action increased. I think the speakers for the tv are good, but I still plan on upgrading to at least a sound bar with a sub for greater depth of sound. So far so good. Only reason 4 stars was I want more time before I give 5, but definitely check this out.

Reviews.Title: 2 Bad Ones In A Row
Reviews.Author: R Shackleford
Reviews.Content: This would have been a great purchase, except I've got two bad TVs in a row... TV 1: Fairly intense "Flashlighting" that spanned about 2 thirds of the screen. From the bottom middle of the screen it was like two flash lights shinning to the top left and right corners. I ordered from Amazon and they make it easy so I decided to give this TV another chance. I got the 2nd TV up and no flashlighting! The picture looked great, I thought all was going to be well... Then later the same day the TV started powering off and on by itself over and over which could only be stopped by unplugging the TV. After plugging it back in it would either become completely unresponsive, turn on and then start turning off and on again, or work normally. From that point the off and on cycle was pretty much constant with short periods of staying on. So the TV will go back, and I'll be going with a completely different TV. Maybe it could be fixed, but I don't want to buy a new product that has to immediately be repaired.This is disappointing, because the picture truly was great. Certainly worth the price, if it worked. The picture was so nice it doesn't feel right saying avoid this TV, but I can't recommend or like it considering getting 2 bad TVs in a row. This model has great reviews everywhere, so maybe you'll be among the lucky.More about the TV...It is very light. The picture is excellent. The options are easy to use. The sound is good enough for a TV.The stand feels too wobbly. Two of the holes for the stand on the first TV were about 1/8" off and required a slight improvement. The screen is more glossy than expected for a LCD which leads to some minor mirroring in some conditions. Most annoying, some light sources can cause a rainbow to appear on the screen I believe due to the glossy screen.My final thoughts... The TV when working with no issues probably would have got 5 stars from me, maybe 4 due to the glossy screen. In the end however, having 2 return 2 in a row because of quality issues I have to rate this TV a 2.

Reviews.Title: Nice HDTV
Reviews.Author: Gerardo Pedraza
Reviews.Content: It has good features, nice resolution and refresh rate and it is not expensive compared to other brands.  The esthetics about how the on/of lights could be improved, but that is just minor cosmetic stuff that nobody besides me cares about.  Over all, great TV. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: Good for watching hd programs; not as impressive for games
Reviews.Author: Leo
Reviews.Content: Purchased this based on reviews on Amazon.  Had purchased a Sony KDL BX421 at Costco.  Tv was good for viewing shows (have dish hd), however Wii games were blurry.  Xbox 360 looked fine though.  Took Sony back and got the LG 42 LK520 instead as it is 120 hz vs Sony which is a 60 hz tv.  Again HD broadcast shows looked clear but Wii games were blurry (slightly improved over Sony though).  PS 2 games were really blurry (don't know if this has to do with the fact that the wii is being routed through an Onkyo AV receiver).  Plan on connecting the Wii directly to the tv to see if this makes any difference.  Would have tried making adjustments on the tv except there are no fine tuning options for the LK520.  Overall tv has advantages over the Sony in terms of inputs ( currently have 3 game systems, satellite, and av receivers connected to tv with 2 hdmi, 1 component, 2 composite inputs) and viewing angle (wider with LG).  Also be aware that if you are a California resident and purchase an item from an Amazon vendor based in California, you will be charged sales tax.  I discovered this after the fact (I've purchased items from Amazon over the years due to their great prices, free shipping, and no taxes.  This is the first time I've paid taxes on a purchase.  The taxes essentially negated any savings from purchasing the tv at a local Fry's).

Reviews.Title: There were so many to choose from...I'm glad I chose this one.
Reviews.Author: Pickngrin
Reviews.Content: There were just too many sets to choose from. I chose this TV in part due to the great reviews and due in part to the 10% off promotion (through American Express), which made for an attractive price. I'm really glad that I chose this 47" LG. The picture is fantastic. I'm using Dish TV and am not used to high definition (used to have standard def. cable on my plasma set). The detail is great and the colors are brilliant. Even my wife (Ms. "Why do we need a new TV?") keeps commenting on how great the picture is. This evening I watched a DivX file using the USB input and found the interface to be much better than that of my DVD player's USB playback feature. I don't expect top notch audio through TV speakers and therefore haven't been disappointed. When watching DVDs, I utilize my 5.1 surround system, but for watching regular television, I haven't had any qualms with the built-in speakers. The remote is well laid out. I haven't done too much tweaking of the settings (just a few), but one key change was that I disabled the Tru-Motion feature; the "soap opera effect" was very pronounced and artificial, but disabling that feature was the solution. This is a great HDTV set.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Choice
Reviews.Author: Rani L.
Reviews.Content: I am a very satisfied customer; ordering through Amazon.com (free shiping included) and owning a new LG 42-inch LCD TV.My son owns a small business in Florida which provides quality technology and entertainment in their customer's homes/business.  His recommendation was the LG TV and I am happy I took his advice.  Is it true that LG was previously owned by Zenith?Thank you Amazon for my no worry experience.R. LouthanMesa, Arizona

Reviews.Title: Excellent product and value
Reviews.Author: JFB68
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to this from a 3 year old 720p Dynex LCD. The picture is excellent for all types of shows including sports and the sound very good. It has enough configuration options so you can get it just right for your viewing environment, source, and type of show. The remote has short-cut buttons to allow you change many settings without having to first navigate through the menu. The printed Quick Start Guide doesn't cover many of the configuration settings but it comes with a CD which has the complete user's manual.As for value Amazon had it for sale at less than $60 then the local big box store, and with free shipping.The only possible negative I've found is that it only has 2 HDMI in ports. It does have a component In though.

Reviews.Title: Despite A Few Refurbished Woes, This TV Initself Is Great!
Reviews.Author: JDP
Reviews.Content: This TV is FANTASIC! I am a Vizio slappy. I cautiously gravitated to the "refurb" Vizio 47inch deal on Amazon, they were out of stock. They convinced me to go with the refurb LG 47inch equivalent. Same price and specs across the board. After some research, I went for it. The price was too appetizing. I will spare you the novel about what happened, but here it is in a nutshell. TV shows up in mail. Box looked good, not trashed out. Plug TV in, began to program channels, wouldn't load channels. Tried it again, then TV powered off and could not turn back on. Called Amazon, did over the phone troubleshoot, no go. They gave me the number to LG Service. Again, did the over the phone troubleshoot, no go. They sent out a tech a couple days later. Ordered I believe a "power board or box"??? Due to overwhelming Christmas deliveries; instead of a day to arrive, took a week, UGH! (not LGs fault) Yet on New Years Eve the component arrived. Stevie the LG tech called and arrived on New Years Eve around 830pm. (finished at 930pm) Fired up my TV and "walah" working great! I was able to watch Avatar on New Years Day, looked great! Then watched my Spartans win the Rosebowl on it. Incredible! Again, I knew I was taking a risk when I bought a refurbished unit, Yet in the end it didn't cost me any more $ just some time. As long as I don't have any more issues, I will say that yeah its worth the risk to save a few hundred bucks. I just wish those dopes that refurbished it would go the extra mile and actually plug the unit in and make sure its ALL good. I don't know what refurbished really means? Just fix precisely what was wrong and re-box it and ship it? Or rebuild the whole whole unit? (that obviously didn't happen) In either case currently I am happy. I will slam the refurb company later, but as for the TV it is a 5star. This is coming from a Vizio slappy.

Reviews.Title: Super
Reviews.Author: Janet Jones
Reviews.Content: Gave this tv to my son for Christmas 2 years ago.  It is still working great !  Not one problem.  Nice picture and sound.

Reviews.Title: LG 47LK520
Reviews.Author: Robert F. Himmelrick "Bob H."
Reviews.Content: It needed to be serviced before it was a year old TV would not turn  on! Was not covered by warranty.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!!!
Reviews.Author: Anthony M. White
Reviews.Content: I really love my TV. Have had it for a while, and it hasn't disappointed one bit! I really like to play my games on it.

Reviews.Title: BIG TV
Reviews.Author: straight arrow
Reviews.Content: Wow!  Great picture.  The sound kinda fluctuates but I got some external speakers that work pretty well.  Sure, I'd recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Arrived broken
Reviews.Author: Woodbury
Reviews.Content: The television screen was cracked when the case arrived.  I had no difficulty, however, returning the box/television and no difficulty being reimbursed for my purchase.  Pleasant experience except for having to return it.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Punkysnares
Reviews.Content: Love this TV! I had never owned an LG before but after much research decided on this one for a large master bedroom. Its great! I only use it for TV and not all the apps but the picture is crystal clear and has great sound. I plan to purchase the new 2013 version of the same tv for our guest room!

Reviews.Title: LG Bad TV Product
Reviews.Author: Isit Picasso
Reviews.Content: Our LCD HDTV broke in less than two years of use.  One day, suddenly no image appears on the screen.  Just a black screen.  The TV will power down after a few seconds every time.  LG makes bad products!!!

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: I. A Harding
Reviews.Content: Bought one here Jan 2012. It's Sep 2013 and it just quit working.  I have taken flat screen TV to the repair center before and been told "They are made of mud and engineered to break just past the warrantee period and not be repairable."Don't pay any more for a flat screen TV than you would pay to rent it for a year because that's what you're doing.Funny thing, Amazon sent me an email flogging a $100 4 year warrantee right after I bought it.  Should have bought that.

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: kira
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for almost 2 years and I love it! Starts up quick and has a great picture!

Reviews.Title: TV ended up needing repair
Reviews.Author: Christopher
Reviews.Content: I loved this tv when I first got it, it was wonderful.However, just 24 months after purchase it stopped working.  LG wouldn't cover it, and I had to pay over $200 to have it repaired.  What a bummer.  :(

Reviews.Title: LG 47LK520 LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Mark Mayotte
Reviews.Content: My son has the 42" version, which I thought was a superior tv to my 50" Sony HDTV, so when the Sony needed a $1000 fix, I bought the LG and a 5 year warranty and came out ahead. This is a fantastic product that I am very happy with!

Reviews.Title: Worst money i ever spent
Reviews.Author: Terry
Reviews.Content: After just 6 mothes it starts shutting off so i contact mfg the have a repair man come to fix it . He takes it to his shop brings it back 3 days later and says "I didnt find anything wrong with it " . Works fine for about 3 more months then quits so i take it to dif shop . He cant find a problem either but suggests maybe an amperage problem so i change out surge protectors . works a week or 2 and guess what . So now i run a independant line just for the tv . Still quits after just a few hours use then wont work for several days then repeat .

Reviews.Title: Perfect After 2 Years
Reviews.Author: Nick Douglas
Reviews.Content: This TV is probably dated by now, but it has stayed through thick and thin in a college apartment for 2 years and still works well.  Product shipped from across the country and arrived in a very beat-up box (shipped on ground), so I would consider buying at a local store because I'm surprised it worked after the damage to the box (but TV thankfully was not damaged).  The refresh rate and high definition are perfect, I don't see why anyone would need a higher spec than this; any further gets barely noticed by the eye.Great TV and worth the money, these new LED TV's are a waste of money IMO, LCDs are just as good and much sturdier and cheaper.  Might even weigh less, as is counterintuitive, but they use metal backing for the LED's and this one has a plastic backing.Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Very user friendly
Reviews.Author: bonnie_star
Reviews.Content: Compared to my fathers flat screen, this one is SO much more user friendly.  Very glad I read the reviews and researched ahead of time. Even my 8 and 9 year old know how to switch back and forth with the input from DVD, to Wii, etc. The quality is also great and when watching shows in HD it is crystal clear.

Reviews.Title: Video is great
Reviews.Author: Leland A. Rozen
Reviews.Content: Superb set with lots of features. Tinny audio as expected. Audio from DVDs is especially weak for some reason I don't understand.

Reviews.Title: Great looking TV
Reviews.Author: B. Clark "G35"
Reviews.Content: My wife and I bought this TV right after we got married as our living room TV.  It is very thing and had a great picture.  It has streaming services built in which is nice but you either need to connect it via ethernet or have a supported wifi usb dongle.  I also loaded up some movies onto a flash drive and was able to play them directly on the tv through its usb port.  I put a movie of an HD fire and left it plugged in (you couldn't see the usb dongle) and it was nice to just play that with some music.  The picture looked really good.  The black levels were not amazing but I didn't expect they would be.  I did run into issues with the TV not responding but after a few software updates that issue went away entirely.  We wall mounted the TV and it was very easy.  The TV is dense so while it isn't heavy it can be a little more than you might think in terms of weight.  There is a noticeable glare if you have a lot of windows but we would just shut the appropriate blinds and that fixed it.  I cannot comment on the sound because I used a surround sound system from the start.  I find most TV speakers really aren't that great despite how they are advertised.The TV itself looks nice.  The bezel is a bit thick and displays fingerprints like crazy but the included microfiber cloth can remedy those quickly.  It has a light on the front that displays LG but all of those lights can be turned off in the settings so that it is all just black.  There are no physical buttons on the TV they are all tough sensitive on the front bottom right corner.  This is slightly annoying because you cannot really see them or even feel them.  Once it notices your finger there it lights them up though.  The TV also has a nice feature that it can turn on and off at a certain time you set and to a certain TV channel and volume setting.  I do this so that it turns on in the morning and I watch the news while I get ready.One thing that was pretty annoying (and is an issue with most thin TVs) is trying to make connections to the back of the TV without looking.  There is very little space between the tv and the wall and even with feeling around first the connections are hard to get right and can be frustrating.All in all it is a good TV.  We have bought another LG since then and use this in our bedroom now.  I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: John Killough
Reviews.Content: For the price of this TV, I don't think it can be beat. No, it does not have every single fancy feature that some TVs do.
