Reviews.Author: Jamie Meisinger "Disney Girl"
Reviews.Content: We love our new LG tv. This is our second LG purchase. Based on reviews and consumer report ratings, we purchased this TV. We didn't need the smart TV option and we decided not to buy a 3D TV. After making the previous two choices, we found this TV. We use it as our main TV in our living room. It is perfect in size, quality, and price.

Reviews.Title: Great tv!
Reviews.Author: Pyro
Reviews.Content: This tv is amazing the picture is near perfect the sound gets you from all around the room and the Eco fetcher is magical. The only problem I have is that the tv briteness will stay low in brite light but it's an easy fix in the main menu. All and all great tv for the money:)

Reviews.Title: LG 42LK520  42"
Reviews.Author: Allan
Reviews.Content: Everything about this TV was excellent except that I could have used a set of audio outputs.  I use headphones most of the time.  But, I like to turn up the TV when the wife wants to hear.  This has a headphone jack, but requires that you yank the headphone out of the TV to get any sound.  I have a Sony in the bedroom, which I have continued to use since it has audio outputs, which allow me to turn the sound all the way off and still hear the headphones, or allow me to turn up the speakers without unplugging any jacks.Everything about this TV is perfect, except for the output jacks.

Reviews.Title: 48 Hour Impression
Reviews.Author: J. Lau
Reviews.Content: I have had this for 2 days now. So far, the tv has been pretty good.PROS:This LG has been everything that i've been looking for, 1080P, 120htz, good looking, lightweight,etc. For the price this is a good TV. The picture is clear and colors seems to be good too. The sound quality is decent. I've receive better signal than my previous tv. There are plenty of port for my needs. The tv was easy to set up and the menu options are easy to use.CONS:Couple negatives so far. The tv does have a thin red bezel that lines the outside of the tv. It is not noticeable from far away but within 2 feet it is noticeable. The stand is wobbly. Whenever you move the tv the tv will shake for a little but remains steady after couple seconds. Even with that point I still trust that the tv will not topple over. Another, you need to point the remote towards the middle of the tv in order for the remote to work. No big deal there though.So far this tv is what i expected it is a good tv at a good price. I will update this review if anything changes.

Reviews.Title: Everything I wanted in a simple TV
Reviews.Author: C. Ryan
Reviews.Content: I needed a TV, but didn't want to pay for all the bells and whistles.  I didn't need the 3D, I didn't want the internet ready or an app store.  I just want a simple, but good quality TV.The picture quality is great.  The Size is perfect.  The price is a little higher than I wanted to spend, but worth it for the quality of the overall product.The sound leaves a little to be desired, but I want to stress - just a little.  Eventually I will get a sound bar, or some sort of sound system - but as long as your not huge audio buff, this TV holds its own and will be just fine.

Reviews.Title: You Won't Be Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Brenda
Reviews.Content: I purchased this T.V. because it was a newer model than Walmart and $50 cheaper.  I couldn't believe it.  I had it shipped right to my house (no hassle trying to fit a 42" flat screet in a corolla and the picture is beautiful, sound is great, and you can't beat the price.

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: Eddychino86
Reviews.Content: Its everything I wanted and more. Its decently priced and I recieved it sooner than expected really really good tv in my opionion

Reviews.Title: Pleased fo Far
Reviews.Author: savey shopper
Reviews.Content: SO far so good.  Feel it was a good deal hope it last more than 3 years like the last tv I bought Samsung paid $1300 for.  Pannel went out 1 month after warranty expired.  Lot of wasted land fill if we all have to make expensive tv purchases every few years hope this new tv last longer as stated.  But this LG appears very nice so far.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: M. Duhamel
Reviews.Content: Purchased this TV several weeks ago. Arrived on time and in good shape. Amazon had excellent price. Price goes up and down so used amazon's price guarantee to get a lower price. They responed very quickly. TV has a great picture and sound is ok. Had to assemble TV to the swivel stand but was not difficult. TV has a matte screen which almost eliminates reflections. This helps a lot. I think the instruction manual could be more complete and clear. Very happy with the purchse. Last year I bought the #1 rated 55" Vizio from Amazon for $1445 before Christmas. I wish this TV would have been out by then becasue I could have saved a lot of money. I am as happy with the LG as I am with my Vizio. This review is for the 47" LG

Reviews.Title: Life IS Good
Reviews.Author: S. Blume
Reviews.Content: This TV has an amazing picture.  It was delivered as promised and was in great shape.  The only issue I had was using my Satellite remote.  After calling Dish and talking to a technician I found out that you cannot use the energy saving mode because the satellite controller's signal is blocked by the signal emitted from the energy saver mode.  I could either buy a new remote or turn off the energy saver mode.  I turned off the energy saver mode and it worked perfectly.  I  didn't  love the energy mode anyway because it made the picture too dark.  Price was very good especially with no tax and free shipping!  LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: Great Tv
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: So far this tv looks beautiful.  Went back and forth on whether to buy the 42inch or the 47inch, and wound up with the 47.  I could not be happier.  I mounted it to my wall with one of the Cheetah Mounts from Amazon, and it worked perfectly.  I don't have much else to say about it... It's a tv.  It looks good.  The sound isn't great coming out of it, but it's workable.  I actually had a set of Logitech computer speakers with a subwoofer laying around so I hooked those up through the headphones jack on the tv.  They sound GREAT in comparison to the tv speakers.  I highly recommend that kind of combo to anyone looking for some better sound out of your tv without breaking the bank (though my speakers weren't super cheap when I bought them).  It will at least get the sound out infront of the tv, and it looks like Amazon sells a smaller version of my speakers for under 30 dollars right now.

Reviews.Title: Good LCD TV
Reviews.Author: RBH110
Reviews.Content: Based upon the reviews I ordered this set.Overall I liked the tv, however I just don't really care for the picture a LCD displays.  I find the picture too artificial, especially the blacks that are always a grey tone to them (local dimming backlight LEDs I think do a better job in getting better blacks).  Maybe the fact my prior tv was a plasma that I watched for a few years has my eyes "tuned in" to that particular display tech. On certain shows where there is a lot of panning across the room, it is still a bit blurry -even with trumotion on (tried low,med,hi), something I didn't have at all with the plasma.Will be returning for a Samsung plasma.(from amazon of course, great service and prices)If you need to put a tv in a very sunny area, I think this would be a good choice as a plasma would not work.  Paid $578, a great price for a good tv.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Robert Shinmei
Reviews.Content: Super fast shipping and product as described! The 120 hz makes it seem like you're watching Blu ray on hd, super realistic. May take some time getting used to but overall solid

Reviews.Title: Met all my expectations
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Sandberg
Reviews.Content: Superior picture, very good audio (be careful when you buy flat screens as some have low watt output - 5 to 6 and in a slightly noisey environment you will not be able to hear the TV clearly).  This unit has 10 watts plus audio enchanement.  Looks great hanging on my wall.  Matt screen allows you to have a great picture even in sunny rooms - I have 9 windows and still a great picture.  Very pleased with this purchase and I got a good price from Amazon.  Shipping was on time and no damage experienced.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product
Reviews.Author: Michael Goldstein
Reviews.Content: Picture is flawless.  Good price.  Great purchase!  No complaints at all.  I would certainly buy an LG product again in the future.

Reviews.Title: Great TV For The Price
Reviews.Author: Dale Curtis
Reviews.Content: I'd been shopping around to replace my Phillips HDTV because the sound went out on it.  I'd had the Phillips for about 6 years and was amazed at how prices had come down.  My eyes were drawn to the LG 55LK520 55-INCH 1080P 120Hz LCD TV.  My Phillips was an LCD TV and I was very impressed with both the durability and picture quality.  I'll be a lifetime LCD TV Buyer.That being said I checked numerous 55 inch TVs and compared price, picture quality, features, sound, and ease of use.  I finally settled on the LG 55LK520.  Everything I needed and nothing I didn't....or so I thought.Amazon delivered it via Pilot Freight with a delivery date of September 6.  Imagine my delight at receiving a phone call saying Pilot Freight had received my TV and would be delivering it on Sept. 1.  WooHoo!  They gave me a 1 p.m. to 5 p.m. window, and were actually at my house by 2:15 p.m.  And here's where I have just a small gripe.  The carton the TV comes in CLEARLY states that it is to be a TEAM TWO MAN LIFT.  Pilot sent one guy.  Myself, I'm disabled, but helped him as best as I could.  Now, the delivery guy was just as nice and helpful as he could be, but sending one man for a two man job is going to get someone hurt.  Pilot, are you paying attention?My brother and nephew arrived about an hour later to help me get the TV set up and going.  Assembly of the TV stand was a walk in the park.  As a matter of fact, everything about the TV was easy to take care of.  Picture quality is amazing.  Sound...eh, not so much.  So as I go to hook the TV up to my Stereo Surround Sound System, I discover no stereo rca outs, only an optical digital out.  This would have been okay, but there was no optical cable included with the TV. So, I had to buy an optical cable and the proper digital to analogue coverter so I could hook the television to my stereo.  However, everything else worked like a charm.  I love this TV.  The instruction manual was clear and concise.  Read it and you'll not have a bit of trouble setting this TV up.  My only gripe...no analogue stereo outs to hook it to my older stereo receiver.  Come on LG, for the price you and everyone else charge for these TVs, what's adding two RCA outs for analogue stereo?**Update**  After watching regular DVDs and some Blu-ray Discs, I am even happier with this TV.  The DVDs look great and the Blu-ray is just AWESOME.  I never expected the picture to be as crisp and clear as it is, especially with this being a 55" TV.  I have to say, I was a little worried after reading some of the negative reviews.  But, I guess that there will always be a few of any product that slip past quality control.  This one, I'm glad to say, didn't.  It's performing just as it should and continues to "WOW" me each day.  Best TV I've bought in a long time.  Still wish it had RCA analogue outs so I could hook it up to my older Surround Sound System.  But I'll have my adapter in soon and I'll let you know if it was worth the extra expenditure.  Now, back to our regularly scheduled program...

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: skg
Reviews.Content: Was a little hesitant to order a large tv online, but this was a great purchase. It arrived very well packaged and shipping was very fast. Saved several hundred dollars over store price and the tv is everything we wanted. Picture and audio are excellent, easy setup. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: awesome clarity and value for money
Reviews.Author: suraj
Reviews.Content: This was the best price that I was getting for a similar product across all brands. The picture quality is really good.The auto brightness sensor is annoying sometimes though as screen gets too dull when the room has less light.Overall a very good TV.

Reviews.Title: LG 42" HDTV
Reviews.Author: dog lady
Reviews.Content: Great, clear picture & good sound.  Just need to figure out how to zoom so all of the screen is visible.  Other than that, I have no complaints what-so-ever -- I love it.

Reviews.Title: almost averything you want in a Hi-Def Tv.
Reviews.Author: bobloumck
Reviews.Content: The LG TV arrived on time and with no damage. Easy to un pack (lots of packing) and assemble the stand provided. Some parts for the stand are shipped loose, check packing before you discard. The picture quality is outstanding,the best I ever had. Be sure to turn off the ambient brightness control,or picture will darken all of a sudden.The only complaint is the audio quality.It is low fidelity,and no amount of compensation with the audio controls will make it acceptable for music,you will need a seperate speaker system.I am very happy with the price and quality.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good
Reviews.Author: Adam
Reviews.Content: I have only been using mine for a few weeks but I am very pleased with its performance. The picture is excellent, watching sports is a new experience for me now. The menu design is so easy to use, connectivity between devices is all really easy. The sound isn't great but I don't think it's bad either. If you want good sound, you'll have to hook up other speakers to any TV anyway. It's a phenomenal value, I highly recommend this TV. The only thing I can't speak of is longevity since I have only had it for a few weeks.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: andy999
Reviews.Content: i had been used this tv for a month.this is an excellent tv,good picture and very good deal.i love it.if anyone need a 42ins tv,get this one.you won;t regret.

Reviews.Title: LG 42LK520
Reviews.Author: Al
Reviews.Content: The LG 42LK520 is great and got a very good price on it.  The picture and sound is great.  Very easy to setup and very easy menu choice.  Very nice TV, no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: 42" LG TV
Reviews.Author: Joannie
Reviews.Content: I have only had the HDTV for a few weeks but the picture is outstanding.  I upgraded from an old TV so the quality of the technology has changed so much and everything operates so much better.  I have had no trouble with it so far and am very pleased with the operation of it.  The only fault I can find is the sound could be better.  This may be due to the speakers located in the back.  I do not have it hooked to stero (surround sound) system. LG 42LK520 42-Inch 1080p LCD TV - Black

Reviews.Title: Satisfied Customer
Reviews.Author: Carl 1935
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with the quality picture and the ease of operation. The sound is not the best, but adequate. I suppose a person could use external speakers, but I haven't tried. I would recomend this TV to anyone. For the price, I don't believe it can be beat.

Reviews.Title: Totally disappointed
Reviews.Author: Rockhound
Reviews.Content: Really surprised at how poorly this tv performed, especially after reading numerous good reviews.  It was refurbished, but I thought that meant it was set up to factory new standards before being re-sold.First of all, the picture is horrible, on non-HD as well as HD broadcasts.  My old Philips gave out, the picture on it was infinitely better.  I also have to constantly change the aspect ratio between different shows, or I have black bars on the sides (if I leave on zoom, it cuts off portions of other broadcasts).I bought the identical tv in a 42" for my lake house - that one works great!  That's why I was so surprised at how bad this one is.  I guess it really is a crap shoot as to which components you get, even in the same model.Oh, I forgot to mention, there were scratches and marks on the set as well.Planet73 is going to have it shipped back and refund my price, but I don't think I'll be getting back the $40 I paid to have it shipped here.  A total waste.

Reviews.Title: Great Bargain
Reviews.Author: natsfan88
Reviews.Content: I looked for a tv for a long time.  HH Gregg was the only B&M; store that had this model at even a remotely close price to amazon (not including sales tax of course).  But what finally got me on board was amazon's 30 day guarantee compared to HH Gregg's 14 day return policy.  The TV was delivered very quickly (although it was left unsigned for on my front door).  The TV itself is great, the picture is very good for the price and it does ok in well lit areas (my home has a lot of natural light).  It has loads of features and settings to tweak unlike lower level models.

Reviews.Title: lgled42"tv
Reviews.Author: jjones
Reviews.Content: ordered on Sat. received on Mon how much better can you get? We replaced an older tv that was in perfect working condition, we just wanted to see the sports in HD. The picture is very good and we are satisfied with the product.

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: One In a Million
Reviews.Content: So far, I've had this TV for 8 weeks and it's been great.  The sound isn't amazing but the picture makes up for what it lacks.  Great buy!

Reviews.Title: satisfied
Reviews.Author: jimah39
Reviews.Content: TV is fine.  I made a mistake.  I thought I purchased a LED but I was mistaken.  I can't tell the difference. No complaints.  Whole process was smooth

Reviews.Title: Great TV for Money
Reviews.Author: mkseym
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the money.  I don't know a lot about electronics but we are very happy w/ purchase.  Picture is wonderful!  Would recommend this TV to anyone.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT except for backlight bleed in corner
Reviews.Author: MetaChimp
Reviews.Content: I love this TV overall, and it is huge and BRIGHT with vivid colors.  The set is a little thick compared to a plasma or LED, but that's to be expected, and worth the cheaper price.Coming from a Plasma screen, I notice a huge difference in the blacks.  When a movie fades to "black", it is an unevenly lit grayish screen.  It looks like a projector trying to "shine" a black image on a screen.  You can still see the light.  I notice it for sure, but to avoid the screen burn-in issues I was having with my LG Plasma, this is an acceptable compromise.The only BIG problem I have is a lot of backlight bleed in the lower right corner during dark scenes or any letterboxed movies.  It actually bothers me quite a bit.  I think I will exchange it for another, and hope it's not a defect in the entire line.With the exception of the light-bleed problem in the bottom right corner, this TV is great for just under one grand!

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Bhaskar
Reviews.Content: This is less of a review and more of an attempt to explain the process which led me to purchase this particular television over other competing models in the same price range. Like most consumers, I was initially overwhelmed by the number of options for buying a decent flat-screen TV, and I hope that this review helps people in a similar situation. Other reviewers have already elaborated on the picture quality, set-up and features of this TV set, and I am loath to beat a dead horse by spending too much time over these details.I needed a decent 42" TV for my bedroom, mainly for playing PS3 games and watching high definition movies. Budget constraints precluded getting a Samsung or Sony LCD television (I was trying to make the best of a meager budget of approximately $500). Another requirement was that the TV should have decent quality sound output, as I am averse to investing in an expensive home theater setup at the moment. I also needed a TV with a fast refresh rate, since fast-paced action sequences in film and gaming on the PS3 might introduce motion blur if the TV were hampered by a slow refresh rate. This last criterion eliminated all 60Hz LCD television sets from consideration, which was unfortunate, since there are a lot of decent 60Hz TVs for the price I was willing to pay.Being open to both LCD and plasma technologies, I shortlisted 3 TVs that fit the bill: this one, the LG 42LV4400 42-Inch 1080p 120Hz LED-LCD HDTV and the Samsung PN43D450 43-Inch 720p 600 Hz Plasma HDTV (Black). The Samsung plasma TV looked promising: traditionally, plasmas are known to offer better contrast, better blacks and better viewing angles than LCD TVs, although the difference between plasma and LCD televisions now is not nearly as pronounced as it used to be. The only thing that put me off about the Samsung was the 720p resolution. This was more idiosyncratic than being backed up by the force of reason: indeed, you can read endless articles online about the 720p resolution being adequate for the screen size of 42 inches as well as being ideal for PS3 games. Be that as it may, in this age of 3D TV sets, I had a distinct sense of unease about putting money down on a lower-resolution TV; I did not want my enjoyment of the TV to be encumbered by a nagging apprehension about it's lower resolution.The LG LED TV looked favorable as well, but customer reviews on Amazon brought to light issues with quality control and the sound output, which ultimately deterred me from making the purchase. Ergo, I decided to take the plunge and purchase this TV set, and thus far I can't be happier with it. The first thing that I did was turn off the Energy-Saver feature as many reviewers have recommended. I tested the television with Uncharted 3, a PS3 game known for it's beautiful graphics and it looked quite amazing. I also played a high-definition copy of Inception and the TV recreated every scene in stunning detail. I compared results against a friend's Sony BRAVIA EX 400 Series 46-Inch LCD TV, Black, and I can safely say that this TV far surpasses the Bravia in both picture and sound quality. While it is possible that the Bravia might look just as good with proper calibration, out of the box the LG TV looked much better.EDIT -- I checked out the product code of my TV and after doing some research on AVSForum, I can conclude that the panel type on my TV is an IPS panel. The product code for my TV is UA-AUSYLFR, where the "Y" designates an IPS panel. For those of you who do not know, an IPS panel offers better viewing angles and less input lag compared to other types. Here is an excellent post discussing this:[...]

Reviews.Title: LG55LK520
Reviews.Author: Charles Sailor
Reviews.Content: Everything about this TV was perfect right out of the box. I know very little about electronics and the set up was super easy.

Reviews.Title: Good TV but mine had a major flaw
Reviews.Author: amrs4444
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV from Amazon's Warehouse Deals and got it for a great price. I read several expert and consumer reviews and was confident that this would be a great TV. The TV is nice, blu-ray and video games look amazing, but I could not get over the dirty screen effect. When watching something with a light background like hockey, there is a very noticeable graininess whenever the camera moves with the action. It was so distracting that I could not watch hockey. It is even noticeable on the grass of a football field or any show that has a light background, even without a lot of movement. This is NOT motion blur, it really does looks like the lcd screen is dirty or dusty even though it is clean, hence the dirty screen effect. I also was not too impressed by the TruMotion 120hz, even with it on high football got pretty blurry during fast action. Also this is an IPS panel, not a VA panel (there are no 47 inch VA panels anyway) so I know the inferior panel is not to blame. I don't know if all the lk520 tv's have this problem to some degree or if I just got a bad set, but I had to return it because this was a deal breaker for me. Even though I loved the set otherwise, I just could not justify paying 650 dollars for a TV with a flaw like that. Also to note: the audio was pretty good, not great. There are a lot of customization options which is a plus. The stand is awful, very unstable.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV for the 46-47" 120Hz category
Reviews.Author: Professor Q
Reviews.Content: I'm extremely difficult to shop for because I'm ridiculously OCD about my product purchases, and everything I buy has been extensively vetted.This TV was purchased for a medium-sized living room with viewers 8-10' away in a 120* arc. The viewing angles are tremendous with fidelity of both color, contrast, and brightness.The controls of the TV are also very well laid out with respect to both the OSD and remote control.The swivel feature is a nice bonus though never used in my case.One feature we love about this TV is its playback of files connected via USB due to its Plex derivative, including the ability to decode x264 MKV files with a bitrate up so 20Mbps, aka HD moves connected via USB flash drive or external hard drive. The navigation is quite good, and I believe it supports both subtitles and multiple audio tracks.The eco-power feature is nice to adjust backlight brightness based on the setting itself and scene brightness.The only bad thing about the TV (other than only having 3 HDMI ports) is that it takes a long time to power up and become responsive. We primarily use ours connected to a Motorola DVR, and it takes a good 5 seconds from power-on until we can adjust the volume.

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: Buddha
Reviews.Content: First off I must say we have been watching a 25in Magnavox consol tv since 1985. The ole girl will not die (still alive and well) . After searching and more searching. Reading all the reviews etc. I finally decided on this LG 42LK520. My wife and I are sitting here in amazement at the picture quality. We just keep shaking our heads at what we've been missing waiting for the ole gal to bite the dust. Thank you Amazon for the speedy delivery. Here is to hoping this baby lasts as long as the ole girl.

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS TV!
Reviews.Author: Tammy "MammaTam"
Reviews.Content: I am so pleased with this TV! It is my 1st flat screen HDTV. I got the HDMI cable a day after the TV and once I hooked up my Cable box using that instead of the Coax cable and realized I had to select HDMI input I am totally thrilled with my picture! The HD channels fill the entire screen and the image is so crisp and clear! My husband even said it looked almost 3D and that was when we were watching a previously recorded SD program via the coax cable! I can't wait for him to really get a good look at this now that I have it set up through HDMI!! I can't wait for my kids to see the incredible graphics when we play the Wii next time either!! They are gonna LOVE IT! OK OK I have said enough.In a nutshell, I am very pleased with this purchase!

Reviews.Title: Great Deal, Great Tele, Icky Shipping, Awful Delivery Alert Feature
Reviews.Author: K. Whelan "giftogab"
Reviews.Content: PRODUCT:This television was just what I wanted! The picture is perfect and so clear. Set up was a cinch. I did it myself and very quickly. (47 inch) The sound is great right from the television, though I will now set it up through my sound system. It looks nice too. This one is pretty basic...no apps...but I would rather replace dvd players with additional features than televisions, so I depend on my blu ray player for any apps I am interested in. I give this a five star rating because I have also watched the same television for a year at both my brother's and father's homes, which is largely why I chose this to begin with. I would have rated lower due to the shipping issues below, but that is not fair to what is a great performing television.SHIPPING:I have Amazon Prime and order from Amazon all the time. Nearly weekly. I have also purchased a television through them in the past. I fully expected the same good service. However, they no longer set the television up. This could be an issue if the television were damaged. I am guessing that it just isn't cost effective any longer with the prices low and the volume high on these sorts of electronics. However, the exepcted delivery was Nov 29. I checked the FedEx tracking and it was OUT FOR DELIVERY the 28th. This concerned me because I had not planned to be home that day. I called Amazon customer service and got on the line quickly on their instant call back feature. But once again, she did nothing I could not have done myself...which was speculate and call FedEx while I was on hold. She did not seem to have any information available to explan how this was going to unfold...whether they would take it back to the facility, leave it at my house or what. Moreover, she really didn't seem to think Amazon should have any assistance to offer since it was a shipping issue. After three times on hold where she simply called FedEx, I got the number myself and called them. Seems that they had a NO SIGNATURE REQUIRED however, the driver did not leave it on my porch. (he clearly had better judgement than the Amazon shipper). FedEx then proceded to tell me they had no information about the actual delivery because it was a third party contractor they sent it out with. They told me it was NOT out for delivery the 28th, but was just turned over to the third party and that it would be delivered on the 29th. They also said the guy was authorized to just leave it but could decide not to if he felt like it. (he had already tried to deliver it by then and did not leave it. FedEx did not know that). Had they been able to track their own product I would have been able to arrive and accept the order and not miss an entire day's work. So I asked for a window of time...they could not give me one. Well, that is not true...the window was 8 AM to 8 PM. I had to take an entire day off work and remain home for the delivery. It came after 4 in the afternoon.  As a prime member this really was not acceptable. What is free shipping worth when you have to burn a day off sitting in your house all day long? Shame on Amazon and FedEx for this! One last thing. I had activated the alert feature for status notifications to be sent to my phone. The driver tried to deliver the television at 12:24 on the 28th. The text informing me of this hit my phone at 12:18 on the 29th....a few minutes short of 24 hours after the fact. I still have not received the alert that the shippment came yesterday. I guess that will come after 4 today.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV for the Price!
Reviews.Author: Paul M. Frasca "PMF"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this for the Master bedroom in my house.  I did not find any better deals and picture quality than this tv.  You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: WOW--LG TV and Soundbar create a powerful effect!
Reviews.Author: Robert M.
Reviews.Content: The 47" LG TV with the matching soundbar (LG LSB316 280W with subwoofer and Bluetooth) by LG make an unbelievable combination.  The HD channels are superb looking and the viewing angle allows everyone in the room to see the picture without any degradation (TV is in the corner so the angles are less than in a room where the TV is placed on a long wall). The soundbar adds several hundred dollars to the price, but the effect of virtual surround is so wonderful that it would be a like a "downgrade" to go without it!  The TV surpasses my wildest expectations and the soundbar with sub-woofer produces higher quality audio than my component stereo system. Couldn't be happier!

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Dirk the Daring "Dirk"
Reviews.Content: The t.v. is wonderful! Coupled with HD t.v. the picture looks almost 3D. I would recommend this tv to another and look forward to having it in my house for a very long time.

Reviews.Title: Good for the money
Reviews.Author: shadkat
Reviews.Content: I like this TV, it is the third LG I have bought from Amazon, however, there was a part missing for the stand, and when I called Amazon who was very helpful, I then had to call LG and they indicated people are saying that all the time. I double checked and double checked and it was not there.  I told LG to ship me one which they did (which was not as fast as Amazon) but I liked the fact that Amazon kept following up with me until I got the part.  Other than that, nice TV, good size, am waiting to install it on wall mount and think that will be a bit better.

Reviews.Title: Superb picture quality, but so-so audio
Reviews.Author: S. Freeman
Reviews.Content: This TV's picture quality is gorgeous -- crisp, realistic, fast refresh -- WOW.  You won't find a a better looking TV picture in this price range.  The screen gets really dim in a darkened room because its "Intelligent Sensor" mode is turned on by default.  I assume that was necessary for its Energy Star rating, but you'll almost certainly want to turn it off.  The trick is to the picture menu, run through the Picture Wizard and create an Expert Mode profile.  From then on, you can use the Quick Menu to tweak the picture controls (brightness, contrast, sharpness, etc) to your heart's content.The audio is just OK, nothing great.  I'm sure it's difficult for a manufacturer to fit high quality speakers into such a slim case, but I was a bit disappointed nonetheless.  And I don't see any speaker outputs, either.  I keep the sound turned down most of the time anyway, so the mediocre audio quality is not a big deal for me.  You might disagree if you're a serious audiophile.The controls were a little bit confusing for the first couple of hours ("How do I control the brightness?  Oh, I have to create an Expert Mode profile first"), but they didn't take too long to get used to.  At least, most of the information necessary to operate the controls are on the web.  LG included a user's guide for the TV on a CD, but I haven't even bothered looking at it.  Google found answers to my questions.------------------UPDATE 9/13/2011I've had the this TV for a month an a half now, and I'm still blown away by its picture quality.  Every time I watch someone else's TV, I think, "Wow, mine looks so much nicer!"  I'm also favorably impressed by how well the TV works in our glarey living room, with windows on 3 sides.  LCDs have historically done poorly in rooms with fluctuating lighting conditions, but this LG TV is great.  The matte screen finish looks nice and helps keep glare a comfortable level.I continue to be underwhelmed by the sound quality.  This TV's speakers sound tinny, especially in the low range.  I personally think people shouldn't have to purchase an entire home stereo system just to get halfway decent sound quality while during the occasional concert on PBS.  But I don't know enough about recently manufactured TVs to know if mediocre sound quality is a problem industry wide, or if it's limited to this particular TV.  I do know that our inexpensive old TV sounded much, much better.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV
Reviews.Author: BIG DAWG STL
Reviews.Content: THIS 42" LG LCD TV IS ONE OF THE BEST BUYS THAT I'VE MADE.  THE PICTURE QUALITY, THE COLOR, & THE A/V MODE FOR GAMES,MOVIES,AND SPORTS ARE EXCELLENT.  THE INSTRUCTIONS TO ASSEMBLE THE TV WERE GOOD. THE CONNECTIVITY OF THE HDMI CABLE BETWEEN THE TV & MY CABLE BOX WAS NOT VERY CLEAR, BUT WITH TRIAL & ERROR IT FINALLY WORKED.  I WOULD RECOMMEND THIS TV TO EVERYONE. IF I NEED ANOTHER TV I WON'T HESITATE IN PURCHASING ANOTHER LG TV FROM AMAZON.COM.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV! Love it!
Reviews.Author: A
Reviews.Content: For 700, this is a GREAT TV.  Great picture and sound- just mounted on the wall and hooked up bluray and hidef cable box- couldnt be happier!

Reviews.Title: LG 47 LCD -- Be careful!!!!
Reviews.Author: BetoUsa "BetoUsa Team"
Reviews.Content: I bought my 47" LG -LCD TV back in December 2010. Everything worked fine until about 2 weeks ago. All of the sudden, the TV signal went off....Not even the PS3 not the WII worked at all. Only a Red font with vertical black stripes is on. I contacted Customer Service and followed all the steps thay advised to do but nothing worked.A Technician call was made. He ent to my house. Checked the TV for almost 5 minutes and then said that is was the motherboard but apparently, there's a backorder on those....(almost 4 - 6 weeks). So it seems that these TV's are suffering of the same problem, over and over and the parts are not available. I'm still under the manufacture's warranty and also bought the extended warranty, AMAZON offered....But just make sure, you are well protected, perhaps you have to go through the same situation. My case is being reviewed, and as I told them I need my NEW TV..Overall experience with TV before the incident, has been very good. It performs very good.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, poor sound
Reviews.Author: GCO
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV visually. Shows sound OK but there's a lot of static when I try to play music.

Reviews.Title: OK for the money
Reviews.Author: Ann Eberhart
Reviews.Content: Don't have experience with any other similar TV's but for what it is worth: Picture is good, most features good. Input button activates for only about 2 sec then goes off so any changes you want to make have to be done too quickly to be easy to use.  Owners manual is a disaster.  Everything from assembly and set up and understanding features is a chore.  Problem is the owners manual is for 48 different models.  Almost impossible to figure out which instructions pertain to your model.

Reviews.Title: Love It
Reviews.Author: Pens Pal
Reviews.Content: I love this TV it does a lot more that I know but I feel it was a good buy.

Reviews.Title: Arrived Broken
Reviews.Author: MissJ30
Reviews.Content: I was so excited when the TV arrived. Then once it was all set up, it kept freezing, and showing an LG screen saver. When I spoke with LG Customer care they had no idea what was going on. I gave my number and was assured that they would call me back by the following morning. Guess what? They never called! So, thank God Amazon makes it easy to return items! They sent UPS to come by and pick it up the following day. However it did take two weeks to get my money back. Big waste of time, and so disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Francisco A. Layrisse "Venexico"
Reviews.Content: A few months with this TV and it has worked great!No comments to add from the great reviews already written.

Reviews.Title: Great picture without HD
Reviews.Author: Ran
Reviews.Content: I had intended to upgrade to High Definition soon after installing my TV, but in the meantime decided to hook it up to my current Direct TV box just to make sure the TV was in working order. I expected the picture to be "grainy," but I was wrong! The picture is perfect and everyone is in agreement. I am amazed that a 47 inch TV picture can look so good without High Def. My wife and I have decided that we are going to keep it as is. A couple of family members that have, or know those who have High Def, also suggested we just keep it as it is.

Reviews.Title: GREAT!!
Reviews.Author: Danielle
Reviews.Content: Great tv! Just received it today, easy set up and wonderful product! Clear picture, great color! No issues so far!

Reviews.Title: What a steal
Reviews.Author: Juan Pablo Zamora
Reviews.Content: Pros:- Price (I bought "used - like new" from Amazon warehouse deals and it even had the protective sticky things) saved like $60 there alone.- If you know nothing technical about TVs just like me, this is what you have to buy.- looks great on daylight and night time.- 2 HDMI slots.Cons:- Sound is a little weak when connected to my comcast dvr but no when conected to my laptop through HDMI.- cant think of anything else.

Reviews.Title: Good TV - terrible sound
Reviews.Author: DjcTVman
Reviews.Content: This is our second LG TV and we love the picture, ease of use, etc. The sound is fine when using just the TV.  However, when you play a DVD, it's TERRIBLE.  You just can not get enough volume!  Once the volume goes past 25, the sound NEVER increases, even if you go up to 80.  They need to use better speakers, but I guess they want you to buy an expensive set separately!

Reviews.Title: Life is Good
Reviews.Author: Ajay Dowden
Reviews.Content: I love it. It was an easy setup and quite nice to view. Getting use to the viewing structure. But it is working out. This will be my office TV because of the size. I appreciate the timely delivery from Amazon. Well worth the price. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Worth the money
Reviews.Author: tomas
Reviews.Content: Shipping---------First things first, shipping was lightning fast as always with free saver shipping (Ordered on Wednesday, tv arrived on Friday).Assembly--------Assembly was a breeze, I haven't done it personally but when I got home from work, my girlfriend had it already up and running...Sound------Do not listed to people who complain about speakers and sound in general, their reviews are very misleading in this matter.Most important thing is to set your expectations right, if I buy a $550 42" 120hz 1080p tv, I don't expect it to have a home theater built-in. Set sound to cinema and it will work, unless you are deaf...Picture-------Key to being happy with the picture is to adjust it, there are preset options as well as picture wizard, if your picture is terrible then either your tv is broken or problem is between tv and the remote.Base stand----------It's wobbly, I don't like it, but it works.Remote/menu-----------Easy to work, good response.LG logo looks cheap, except for base stand that's the only negative I could find so far, well worth the money in my opinion, happy with it so far. Didn't have a chance to play with True Motion a lot so can't really say much about it.Make sure you turn the energy saver off.. I'm not sure how much energy it saves but it can't be worth the hassle.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Janis E. Smith "CPA-number geek"
Reviews.Content: Okay, so I never purchased a tv online. I had to admit I was concerned on how it would arrive and if I would like it. Arrived perfect, no dings or scratches. Now for the TV, I bought this for our master bedroom. Really like the tv, only thing I need to play with is the brightness. Set it for standard setting for home use and seemed too dark. Changed the setting to Vivid and it was better but still seems too dark. Tried the setting that adjusts to the room lighting and couldn't even see the picture when the lights were off. Overall, I would recommend this tv and would buy another LG if the need arises.

Reviews.Title: great TV
Reviews.Author: SKE
Reviews.Content: My new LG 55LK520 55-Inch 1080p 120 Hz LCD HDTV is great.  I also usit as a computer monetor, so I can stream netflix movies.  I am very pleases with this tv,

Reviews.Title: HDTV
Reviews.Author: George D. Johnson "GeoGolf"
Reviews.Content: My purchase of the 47" LG TV was my first HDTV. My wife and I did a lot of research work before deciding on the LG TV. We are very pleased with the clarity and quality of the picture. I would highly recommend this HDTV for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great unit, good price
Reviews.Author: Mark Zieg
Reviews.Content: I visually compared brands at Wal-Mart and identified this model as a good intersection of size, quality, features, and cost.  I was frankly ready to buy in the store and take it home in the van, but thought I'd just check the comparable price on Amazon.  Amazon offered the same system for $80 (more than 10%) cheaper, including free 2-day shipping under Prime.  I'd never shipped anything that big or expensive through them before, but decided to give it a try.  Sure enough, the unit arrived in perfect condition on the 2nd business day; while the outer cardboard box had a few nicks and scrapes from UPS, nothing penetrated and the screen was perfectly safe behind 4-inches of styrofoam.  It was a breeze to mount on the enclosed stand (helps to lay the screen down on a bed for attaching), and looks great framed by matching black Ikea "Billy" bookcases.  No qualms or quibbles at all!(I'm not a sufficient audiophile to comment on the sound, and the picture quality is more than adequate to my imperfect vision, so don't rely on me for A/V judgement -- but it looks and sounds perfectly fine to me, after testing with digital HD cable and a few widescreen DVDs).

Reviews.Title: LG Television
Reviews.Author: James E. Ennis
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this TV.  My research paid off and it works just great.  My only negative feeling is about the speakers which are located in the back of the TV and, as a result I find that I have to run the volume much higher than I am used to so the sound can "bounce off the wall" and back out to the sitting area.  I understand that I will probably need a sound bar to remedy this situation to my liking.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy!
Reviews.Author: flaboy772
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints after 3 months of owning this TV.  Picture is very good and happy with the sound. Range and ease of the remote is great. Highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: LOVE my new TV!
Reviews.Author: wifisker "treinejl"
Reviews.Content: The TV arrived just when Amazon said it would and the packaging was in good condition. It was super easy to set up by myself and it had no problem finding channels when it ran the scan.  The picture and sound quality are great and overall I thought this was the best value I found on an LCD of this size and with these features and brand reputation.  I got it on sale and was able to use an additional promo code at the time.  Awesome!

Reviews.Title: Great Choice For Me!
Reviews.Author: Dashagirl
Reviews.Content: I love the tv - the picture quality is excellent - however, the sound quality is just ok. It was well packaged and arrived within a couple of days of ordering.

Reviews.Title: Analog audio out?
Reviews.Author: S. Wright
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice TV. The price is very good too. I read through several reviews before deciding on this LCD TV. One of my major concerns was that there was no analog out in order to hook up my Klipsch ProMedia 2.1 Computer Speakers to this set. Please note that this set does have a headphone out jack that makes this connection possible. I highly recommend the Klipsch speakers. They are designed for desktop computer use but are also great as a substitute for a full blown home theater system. The three piece Klipsch system is only $150 and are well worth the price. They can really put out high quality sound and can save you hundreds when trying to put together a home theater system.

Reviews.Title: EXCITED.
Reviews.Author: ZOMbehGamer
Reviews.Content: I just purchased the 42LK520 which was just shipped today. I will give a full review when I receive it and and I fully test it. Hopefully that will be in a few days! Thanks for the reviews everyone, this is my first HD LCD purchase and I'm excited.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tv
Reviews.Author: braaa
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before buying this tv and read a lot of reviews. There were 3 reviews that made me not want to buy this tv, 1) which said that video games lag on this tv. Owning a ps3 this concerned me a lot, but this is only due to true motion technology. Turn off true motion and there is no more lag. 2) review said that it makes tv look like a video from a video camera, turn off or turn down the true motion sensitivity and it looks a lot smother. I only turn on true motion when watching action movies or sports, this allows the picture not to blur. 3) the sound of this tv is similar to other LCD, does the job for me, it is not horrible like other reviews.Great price and great tv not to mention 3.99 next day delivery.

Reviews.Title: Great budget tv
Reviews.Author: C. Bookman
Reviews.Content: This tv was the same price as a similar vizeo, but has a nicer picture, remote, and design.  The speakers on the tv are kind of tinny.  It is really only an issue when you play 1st person shooters on xbox..etc, and movies with big "bangs"For the price though I would rather sacrifice speaker quality for picture quality (what this tv does), and since this tv is cheap, just hook up a set of 50 dollar speakers, or a sub and it will be more than fine.The stand will wobble if you move it around, but after 5 secs. It will stop the wobbling, so it's not really an issue.

Reviews.Title: PRetty Good, but Roku Users, Be Aware
Reviews.Author: Catharsis
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV as a a spare TV for my bedroom.  The picture and the sound quality are good, I don't have an HD signal running to it, and I can't complain.  One thing that I found out, though, and I'm pretty sure that this is the same on all the TV's.  When using a ROKU player, if you have the powersaving option on, it will interfere with the signal from your Roku remote.  No problems with my 27" tube, just this flatscreen.  From talking to the people at Roku, they have heard this problem reported before.  So, a heads up.Othe than that, no real complaints.  On retrospect, I would have paid the extra $300 to get an LED aith wireless, then I wouldn't need the Roku at all, and could surf the net in my bedroom.  But for a basic television, I couldn't beat the price.

Reviews.Title: Good in general - but fault in TV Stand causing TV to be inclided
Reviews.Author: ks_sk
Reviews.Content: TV arrived in time and all together. it was relatively easy to put it together and set it up. however there was an issue with the stand to allow the TV to stand on the counter. despite many adjustments there was always an inclination to one side and the TV was not horizontal.amazon could not replace the part but LG said they would send a replacement piece. Still awaiting shipment for the piece.the picture clarity is good however everything looks like a home video? dont know if it becuase of the TV or if all HD shows seem like it because of the resolution?

Reviews.Title: Disposable TV by LG
Reviews.Author: William Hanger
Reviews.Content: Bought a 55 inch LG model 55LD650 in May of 2010 for $1,500 through Amazon.  After a little over a year the TV started to turn itself off.  This was an occasional problem that became worse over the ensuing months.  There was no pattern to the unexpected turn offs.  I searched the internet and found that many people were having the same type of problems with their LG televisions.  I replaced the surge protector and the wall outlet to make sure the problem was not the electrical service.  The problem persisted and eventually it became unwatchable so I finally called LG customer support.  The support woman was friendly and arranged for an LG technician to come diagnose the problem.  She did advise that, "since I failed to protect my investment with an extended warranty," I would be charged $89.00 for the service call.  The warranty was for one year.  I expected to be charged knowing that I was out of warranty so I agreed to the price of the service call.The service technician that came was pleasant but barely spoke English.  He asked me what the problem was and I explained it to him.  He said that I needed a PCB main assembly and told me the part was $410 and the labor another $150.  Said I could buy a new 55 inch LG television for $1,000 and shouldn't fix this one.  He did no diagnostic work and was only at the house for 10 minutes.  Most of that time was spent trying to explain the problem to someone who did not grasp the language.  He collected his $89 and gave me a receipt.  I noticed on the pre-printed receipt it already had the description of my problem that I had given the customer support woman.  He could have called me and not charged for a service call as he obviously didn't want to fix the television.The only good thing that came out of the service call was he put the part number of the PCB main assembly on the receipt.  Amazon sells the part for $176 and another business sold it for $136.  I took my 'disposable TV' apart and in twenty minutes had the PCB main assembly disconnected.  The new part arrives in a few days and hopefully fixes the problem.  If not, I certainly won't be buying a new LG.  I have disposable lighters that lasted longer than my LG television and I didn't pay $1,500 for them.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality
Reviews.Author: Richard W. Jefferis
Reviews.Content: This TV broke after 2 months, it was seldom used but the digital sound stopped working and there is no other audio out except for headphone, this is a large cheap no frills tv that should be avoided at all costs (pun intended)

Reviews.Title: 6 Days and It Broke
Reviews.Author: barbara reiser
Reviews.Content: Purchased the TV from Amazon. Great price, free delivery and fast set up. The TV suddenly had thin verticle lines and the colors were muted. Used LG's chat support service and they sent a repair tech. So 6 days later and I have no TV. Do not buy this product.

Reviews.Title: Disappointment
Reviews.Author: ronen
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV 3 months ago. I have to say that for the price I paid this is a very good product (when it works...)My only complaint is that the entire LCD panel malfunctioned only 2 months after I bought it!!! this is ridiculous. I called customer support and they sent technicians to look at it. they had to take it to their lab for repair (at least it has 1 year warranty).The repairs contractor LG is working with in my area is called Alpha TV & Electronics, and their service is just awful, they were late to pick it up (had to take 1/2 day off work) and took them 11 days to fix (they promised to bring it back after 5). They were also very late returning it, wasting another half of my day (this time it was a Saturday. thanks a lot).I have and had many LG products in my life and was always happy, but this time I'm very disappointed with LG.I will not recommend this product to anyone. 1 start. next.

Reviews.Title: am i in a movie, or is it a huge tv
Reviews.Author: francis
Reviews.Content: this is a great tv, glad i got it over led.  Right out of the package perfect.  Got it shipped, free economy(pilot shipping) which i was iffy about but they called me, made an appointment, came on time walked it upstairs and left it in the room.  Set up was easy NO DEAD PIXELS at all, thank the gods.  Sometimes i feel i can punch threw the tv and hit the person in the movie.  Worked twice so far, but in all honesty this is an amazing tv at a amazing price.-BLOCK

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: ChefChip
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about buying this sight unseen. But I have been getting things from Amazon for years and am always happy  with what i have purchased. This tv is no exception. I have a few LG products around the house and have been very pleased with their performance. I reasearched extensively and finally settled on this tv, as it seemed to have the most bang for the buck for me. I don't need a rediculously large screen so the 42" size is perfect for my room. The menu and setup was intuitive and quick. I fired the cable company and went with OTA signal with an indoor Mohu antenna and the picture is unbelieveable. I love it! Also hooked up my laptop and able to use it with a bluetooth keyboard as a giant monitor and can watch stuff from  the many streaming sites that i have now joined.The only thing i don't find excellent on the set is the stand. Not that i don't trust it, it just isn't as strong a build as the rest of the tv. Also sound is lacking, but I expect that as most people have surround systems and minimal investment in sound keeps the price low, under $600 in my case.Bottom line, BUY IT!

Reviews.Title: Aggravated with LG
Reviews.Author: meeko350
Reviews.Content: TV has a nice picture and sound.  My box wasn't packaged well.  I ordered a new tv, not open box.  The bottom of the box was missing & only one side was secured.  I had a hard time getting the tv inside because the tv kept trying to fall out of the box.  Part of the stand was missing (the stand body) which made it impossible to attach the base. I've had it propped against the wall for almost two weeks while waiting for LG to send the missing part.  Today I received another stand base from LG instead of the stand body. If LG can't overnight the correct part, I'm returning the tv because if I have to wait another two weeks, my 30 day return period will expire.  This isn't an isolated event, because another Amazon reviewer was also missing part of the stand.Also, an important feature is missing.  Most newer tv's auto switch the input source when an HDMI device is turned on.  I have older tv's that automatically switches the source when I turn my blu ray player on, but the LG doesn't.  I emailed LG about the issue asking if there is a special setting that I need to change, and they stated that LG tv's don't do this.Update:  I emailed LG on 7/26 advising that they sent the wrong part.  The rep didn't even bother to read my email and replied that the part was mailed on 7/22.  I finally did a live chat and got a different rep who said she would try to overnight the correct part.  If it doesn't show up by Friay, the tv is going back because I no longer have much faith in LG.

Reviews.Title: LG quality control
Reviews.Author: Max Elliot
Reviews.Content: They sent a base stand for a 2010  model, received  TV on the 23 and reported wrong model # on base...............on the 23rd.....LG 42LK520 42-Inch 1080p LCD TV - Black they just approve the replacement  stand today 7 to 10 days not saying much for LG quality control service to customer. So TV lays flat on it face now. 1st rep was from oversea, I told him many times I knew how to attached base. I ask for his supervisor and was put on forgot. I had the part number on the base. Base which did not mate with the stand. The screws were a different thread and the mounting holes 2 were off position. LG why make a customer wait for a base, probably a $2 item.

Reviews.Title: Terrible
Reviews.Author: rodriguezgcr
Reviews.Content: My experience is terrible. I only had the tv for 1 month, then it started to turn OFF and ON alone. 10 min later, i couldn't turn it on again. For my bad, i'm not in states to apply the warranty, so i had to take it to service apart in my country. They said it is the main power supply internal card. Now I have to go to the states to find this spare because here, i can't find it.I can bet this is the last time I buy LG, and I mean any product

Reviews.Title: 47LK520 - Audio Issues
Reviews.Author: Sinan
Reviews.Content: Packaging was weak, bottom of the box was missing. Overall it looked like a used product from outside.I was expecting an Amazon prime shipment, instead it was shipped ups ground and arrived in 10 days.After a quick, straightforward installation, I realized that- the picture quality is pretty good- menu and usb interface is amazing- I'm having trouble with my Sony home theater connection thoughThere seems to be a lag when my home theater is connected to the TV through Amazon's optical audio cable.I realized this lag both on Fios channels and on movies played via USB drive. Overall, TV speakers and my home theater speakers are not perfectly synched when connected through optical audio.When my home theater system is connected straight to the FIOS box, the lag is minimal or gone.I will update this review, after speaking with LG about this issue.

Reviews.Title: pissed off
Reviews.Author: Blouin
Reviews.Content: had the tv for an hour it randomly shut off and wont turn back on basicly broken after an hour Great....... i will see how they handle this and how fast i really dont wanna wait another 3 weeks for  a new one im so mad as can be im ready to flip.

Reviews.Title: everything is good, execpt the color definition
Reviews.Author: RHSS
Reviews.Content: the color is weird. when we watch a drama, it is very dark color. but other TV programs, it looks normal. i tried so many time to adjust the color, but couldn't be successful.

Reviews.Title: Can't fix the blur
Reviews.Author: Disappointed
Reviews.Content: I've had the LG 55LK520 for a couple of weeks now and have tried all the adjustments there are and I still have a problem with images blurring even during such things as someone stirring a bowl on a cooking show.  I've tried turning the TruMotion off, on low and on high, even adjusting the dejudder and deblur all the way up to 10 and nothing seems to help.  There is also a problem with what looks like a heat wave coming off someone's head when they are walking across the screen, don't know if this is the "halo effect" I've read in other reviews.  If anyone out there has had similar problems and can offer some advice I'd love to hear it.

Reviews.Title: Sound issues after six months
Reviews.Author: Tweek
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this TV.  Unfortunately, after about six months it started making a low humming/buzzing noise when the sound hits certain frequencies.  I'm not sure if it is the speakers or a vibration in the cabinet.  Either way, it's really distracting and not acceptable.  The TV is in a small room and the built-in speakers were entirely sufficient before this - in fact, I really liked them.Amazon shipping was fast and they came through with a price match 10 days later.  I had expected the TV to ship in a brown Amazon box, but they just stuck a shipping label on the brightly colored and clearly labeled original box.  UPS would have left it unattended on my porch had I not been home (per my driver) so keep that in mind.

Reviews.Title: Great producr, great delivery
Reviews.Author: jeep
Reviews.Content: Received ffrom Amazon in plenty of time for Christmas, in fact operational well before Christmas.  Assembled easily and has been operational since with great pictures and sound. It sure beats going to retail stores and get the "smoke and mirrors"!!jeep

Reviews.Title: Worth every penny!
Reviews.Author: quickster
Reviews.Content: This TV is awesome. They picture is ultra clear. Very hi definition for an LCD! I ordered this TV on a Sunday and it was delivered to my door at 1pm on Tuesday, today! I was like woah! lol Its a perfect size for the size of my living room. The distance from my eyes to the screen is about 13 feet. I went and got renters insurance as of today because I would be pissed if somebody broke in and stole this!

Reviews.Title: Excellent LED TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: Lori Baby "noybeezwax"
Reviews.Content: We shopped around for a 42" TV and compared reviews to the Vizio and other models that were not as expensive as Sony, for instance.  We read that the LG was met with more customer satisfaction.  We couldn't be happier with this TV.  It has a beautiful, clear picture, was so quick and easy to set up and the price couldn't be beat.  We had free shipping, it arrived in 5 days and perfectly packed.  It is a gorgeous TV at a great price.  Plus LG customer service is available 24/7 and they are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: Don't like LCD Displays
Reviews.Author: Luke
Reviews.Content: I had this tv for about a month and as far as LCD TVS go, it's pretty good.. But to be honest plasma display is what looks the best.. It doesn't  have any motion blur like LCD does.. I settled on the Panasonic GT30 and love it..

Reviews.Title: Great LCD TV
Reviews.Author: KB
Reviews.Content: This LCD TV was purchased at good price with quick delivery before Xmas. Easy to setup and use. Good sound for a TV. Picture is awesome, it is like you are at the game or in the movie.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV - am not an audio/visuaphile
Reviews.Author: PML
Reviews.Content: Read a lot of reviews for this TV before we bought it - Poor sound, "faded" picture, etc., etc.As you read, it seems that almost all of the reviews are from gamers holed up in their basement, playing World of Warcraft or something similar.  To be honest, we needed a new TV for the living room and we got this.  It's great!  Excellent picture, sound is fine.  I'm not trying to have a home theater that has all the latest and greatest (and most expensive) gadgets.  I just want a nice, big TV that works well, and it does.  Colors look great, sound is fine - no problems.If you want a good TV at a great price - compared to some of the others we looked at - this is it.  If you want 2080p with 475 Hz renew speed and Dolby surround sound from small speakers to do your gaming on - go buy a more expensive fancy TV.  This is a good TV from a reputable company - enough said.

Reviews.Title: awesome picture quality
Reviews.Author: chris
Reviews.Content: after having a rear-projection tv we wanted a flat screen with better picture clarity and we found it in the LG 55-inch model. Until now we were not familiar with LG products, but after I hooked it up to our surround system, it's hard to turn off the tv!

Reviews.Title: taking the other reviews at face value...
Reviews.Author: Crybaby "beaks"
Reviews.Content: Was torn between this TV and Samsung LCD LED 40".  Samsung is better picture, but light bleeding problems by reviewerswere a concern.  Plus, didn't want to muddy up the waters with a "smart" tv, especially since there's no netflix availableoverseas.  Am shipping it directly to the Philippines via Johnny Air Cargo San Francisco for $280. inclusive, aheadof my arrival in Sept. (moving there).  Can't comment on this TV other than to say I did exhaustive research onlineand at 5 different stores, including Costco.  Conclusion: excellent picture and overall quality of TV = many years ofenjoyment for my family.

Reviews.Title: VERY, VERY UNHAPPY!!!
Reviews.Author: Mr.Jaxn78
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv in mid January. and the lag and pixelation that occurs when theres a fast moving scene in a movie or tv show or even when the scene switches is unbelievabley horrible!! the sound quality is pretty bad as well! I Have to turn the volume up to over 20 to hear the words even with the Clear Voice feature turned on! then the background noise like car chases or music, explosions are so loud it sounds like it may damage or blow the speakers! I had to buy headphones to watch movies late at night because I kept waking my family up! and even with a professional adjustment to the colors and picture (which was NOT cheap) the people appear yellowish and green! AND the TRU-MOTION feature is just garbage! it makes everything seem way too fast and makes the lag and pixelation way worse!! I saved for many months to buy this tv because of all the good reviews only to get a piece of crap!! dont know if all the LG tv's are this way or I just got sold a lemon but Im VERY unhappy with this product!! I even called LG to see if they could possibly fix or replace it and they told me that I'd have to pay to have it shipped to them and possibly pay to have it fixed and shipped back!??? lol, needless to say I will NEVER buy another LG product again!!

Reviews.Title: Seemed like a good tv - maybe just got a bad one
Reviews.Author: GJ
Reviews.Content: Bought the tv on sale for less than 600, which made me pretty happy since it was such a highly rated tv by amazon customers.  Got it shipped through Amazon Prime (thank you, trial!!!!) and unpacked and set up with minimal fuss.  Left it sitting there for a couple of weeks without really using it besides running video/audio from my laptop to it a couple of times and was very happy with the quality. Then decided to finally hook up the cable box to the tv via the component cables and heard a pretty distinctive buzzing sound.  Switch back to the pc input and had no buzzing phenomenon taking place, so I decided to do some digging:1) Switched out the cable with the one from my tv downstairs - still had the buzzing.2) Switched out the cable box with a dvd player I had downstairs - still had the buzzing.3) Switched from Component 1 input to Component 2 input - still had the buzzing.Reluctantly, I contacted amazon to return the tv since I could not stomach keeping a tv that was really only fully functioning in PC input mode.  I'm giving it two stars since I loved the automatic response it had to switching up inputs as soon as they were connected and it looked beautiful when I did have netflix streaming on it via my laptop.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY LG
Reviews.Author: paul
Reviews.Content: We just bought this LG tv and after 8 days it came on all by itself, wouldn,t shut off, none of the controls worked. After having to pay to have it unmounted, LG service came and replaced two of the three boards inside and left. Four hours later the same problem arouse. After calling LG again, they can,t come till next week, won,t replace the unit and I have to have it unmounted again before they service it. After speaking to a supervisor, I got no satisfaction at all. The worst customer service I have every dealt with. They just do not care. I strongly recommend buying a different brand.

Reviews.Title: TV Review
Reviews.Author: J. Davis
Reviews.Content: I am please with the LG TV.  It has lived up to the reviews that I look at.  I research many TV's before I made this purchase. I hope it continue to perform well in the long run. Only time will tell.

Reviews.Title: Wish it had louder audio
Reviews.Author: D. Joshi
Reviews.Content: Only issue i have with this is the audio is not loud enough. Other than that its a great tv.

Reviews.Title: 60HZ better than 120 HZ
Reviews.Author: hugh parker
Reviews.Content: Every single broadcast or motion picture is in 60HZ, NO EXCEPTIONS. Oversampling to 120 or (worse) 240 only distorts the original, and that is why the hollow look on 120s and 240s. You will profit if you turn this model to 60HZ, I promise. The picture will not look so stark and unreal. That weird look you're seeing with 120 is not just you, it's the fact of how everything everywhere has been and is filmed in 60. 240 looks like a cartoon. This tv can be adjusted back to the original 60, and you will like it much better.

Reviews.Title: TV has a red border
Reviews.Author: Mr. B. GRAY
Reviews.Content: Be aware that this product has a thin red/maroon border around the outside frame that is not apparent (nor described) on the website.  I found the overall picture quality to be good, but not great.  Definitely noticed the "dirty white" image problem noted by other reviewers.  When viewing some content, (e.g. a fully downloaded - not streamed) HD movie, the picture pixelated (sort of a scrambled digitized view) between 2 or 3 scene transitions in a 2 hour movie.  Also, I got spooked by the discussion thread that seems to indicate a 30 day breakdown problem for the LED version of this product of the same size (LG 47LV4400).  Note:  The problem has NOT been noted on this model, but other reviewers were not impressed with LG's customer service response so that also contributed to my decision to return this item.

Reviews.Title: THE OWNER'S MANUAL LACKS VIEWING INFORMATION
Reviews.Author: C. E. Wilson
Reviews.Content: PERHAPS I WOULD GIVE THIS TV A 5 STAR RATING BUT AM DISAPPOINTED IN THE OWNER'S MANUAL.  IT CONSISTS OF 53 PAGES OF REDUNDANT INFORMATION ON MANY MODELS, BUT ONLY 3 PAGES OF A SECTION CALLED "WATCHING TV".  INFORMATION THAT I AM SEEKING IS NOT THERE.HOW CAN I OBTAIN BETTER OPERATING INSTRUCTIONS ABOUT THIS TV?

Reviews.Title: Not a gaming tv
Reviews.Author: Evan Colarusso
Reviews.Content: Do not buy this TV if you are planning to use it for gaming. The lag is unbearable. Otherwise, the color representation and brightness are good and the tv has nice look. Since I bought this tv with gaming in mind, I will be returning it due to the lag.

Reviews.Title: Don't Waste Your Money On LG
Reviews.Author: Taylor
Reviews.Content: I bought my second lg. The first one lasted 14 months. For the price I bought a second on a prayer, now after 8 months the picture started jumping and ghosting. It was still under warranty, but now 2 months later I am still waiting for my tv to be fixed. These tvs are made in Mexico. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY. I talked to a profesional and he said to get one with a least a 3 year coverage and one where they will come to your house to fix it. No use spending a lot of money on something thats not going to last. Next time I'll go through Dell where I can buy more coverage. I will never buy LG again. I have a friend who bought an LG refrigerator that lasted a little over 2 years.

Reviews.Title: A WISH COME TRUE
Reviews.Author: Mr. Ramonn B. Jones "tripleaj"
Reviews.Content: FOR SOME TIME NOW I'VE WANTED A BIGGER TV FOR MY BEDROOM AND FINALLY I GOT AN LG 42"! SO FAR IT HAS PROVEN TO B EVERYTHING I'VE WANTED IN A TV.A BEAUTIFUL PICTURE,AN EASILY PUT TOGETHER! THOU SOME TOUGH SAILING EARLY ON WHEN TRYING TO GET MY DVD AN ROKU PLAYERS TO WORK WITH THE TV. IT WAS DRIVING ME CRAZY! JUST HAD TO FIGURE OUT WHICH REMOTE TO NAVIGATE BETWEEN THE 3 AND NOW I'M ROLLING LIKE DICE! TO BAD ONE REMOTE DOESNT DO EVERYTHING AS I HAVE THE DISH! IF POSSIBLE, WILL SOMEONE PLEASE SHOW ME, AS I USE 4 DIFFERENT REMOTES, AN THIS IS THE ONLY FAULT I FIND, BUT LIKELY DUE TO THE DISH FOR RECEPTION AND NOT CABLE! ANYWAY, I'M VERY HAPPY, AS LONG AS I DONT LOSE A REMOTE!LOL

Reviews.Title: Life's not so Good
Reviews.Author: James R. Bott
Reviews.Content: Delivery was right on time.  Set up was a snap (and I have set up several previously) - got it out of the box and connected in just a little over 1/2 hour.  So far so good.  Turned it on:  Sound but no picture, and it flipped to screen saver mode in 15 seconds so there was no time to try anything. Did multiple tries to no avail.I did find out that the LG customer service is very responsive.  They spent nearly 30 minutes with me trying to get it fixed, which was also to no avail.  The customer service rep schdeuled me for a tech appointment,without being passed around, whichwas nice.  But, the bottom line is that I have an inoperative "new toy," and am very displeased/frustrated.  For the record this is my fourth on line TV purchase, but the first one that did not work.  Doubt I order a TV again.

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected...
Reviews.Author: Jenz
Reviews.Content: I'm a little disappointed in this TV. But I guess you get what you pay for. The price was good, but the clarity is not so good. Everything is so dark. I've made color adjustments, and it doesn't seem to help. When I play the Blue-Ray, the color is much better.

Reviews.Title: Price could have been better!
Reviews.Author: tubabigirl
Reviews.Content: I like this TV so far. The only thing I don't like is the high definition, makes everything you watch look fake..I like the old school style, were it actually looks like you watching a movie and not a home video! but for the most part its a nice looking TV!

Reviews.Title: Question
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Guys does anyone notice that while playing first-shooter games on this screen the aiming isnt so smooth? I played cod bops and bf3 on it and the aiming is just terrible is it because of the tv? i have an excellent hdmi cable so i doubt the problem is from the cable. I have used that cable on other tvs and the results were always great.  Im really confused would anyone assist me? Is anyone having these problems too?

Reviews.Title: My new flat, wide screen TV
Reviews.Author: Spanky
Reviews.Content: First my new hearing aids, then a new washer and dryer but now (at last) my new wide, flat screen TV.  I am enjoying it immensely!!!Spanky

Reviews.Title: Damaged in shipping
Reviews.Author: Vinayak
Reviews.Content: Anyone who is purchasing TV on amazon with Free Shipping, be ready to take a risk of receiving it all screwed up.The TV will be in the UPS truck for almost 5 days taking every impact. When I first got my TV i went back to check if I had ordered a use d one :). The package looked so bad. After turning it on...boom...nothing comes up on the screen, i could hear the channel sound but no picture. I saw the TV package box and noticed a big hole on it...UPS truck driver has *up the TV.But thanks to the return policy, i shipped it back. I am now waiting for the refund.

Reviews.Title: HD is a gimmick......cost more when you go big screen
Reviews.Author: Helen Sealey
Reviews.Content: If I knew anything about buying a larger TV, especially a HD, I would have kept my old big fat 32" tv.....at least I was watching a 32" tv and not a small tv, though I bought a 42" HD, I can only see about 30" of it....because, no one told me that buying a HD tv, cost 120 dollars more a year, every year and maybe it will increase too.  HD is not free, so if you decide to watch tv thinking if you bought a larger set, you will not get to see the whole picture....unless you tell your cable company its a HD and pay at least 10 dollars more a month....IM sure the quality of the picture is great in HD, but why do we have to pay for expensive cable as it is now and more for HD? so expect to pay at least 10 more a month if you want the screen bigger, because it does not show the whole picture even if you bought the screen size bigger.....
